review: I haven't been to a Red Robin in ages, but we decided to go on Veterans Day to take advantage of their free burger offer for my bf who's a veteran. Conveniently my birthday is in November so I was able to join their loyalty program and also get a free birthday burger. We went at 9pm on Saturday and were initially told it would be a 30 min wait, but it ended up only being about 10 minutes. Our server was very upbeat and friendly. I'm not a vegetarian but I don't eat beef. Initially I was leaning toward a turkey burger, but the veggie burger caught my eye. Our server said they had just revamped it to be a lot better than their previous version, so I decided to give it a try. I loved all the components of the veggie burger and it tasted great. Red Robin has several dipping sauces for the fries - some are free and some have a slight upcharge. We liked the ranch and campfire (creamy BBQ), but weren't fans of the Red's secret tavern sauce. Overall we enjoyed our visit to Red Robin. While our meal this time was free (and yes we did tip the server well), the menu prices are very reasonable and we would go back. Edit: Forgot to add that my bf was given a nice thank you card for Veterans Day, that was hand signed by several of the employees. I thought this was a very thoughtful gesture.

There were hardly any people in here tonight - sat at the bar and ordered food - after waiting for over 20 minutes we noticed food that looked like ours sitting in the window - at least 4 different servers walking past, bringing out their orders not giving it any attention.  Finally flagged a person to see if it was ours, that it had been sitting for sometime. She went to the window, put the back of her hand on it to check the (lack of heat) 2 other servers then proceeded to do the same before sending one back...nice.. (Not) paid our drink bill and went elsewhere. Lame.

I usually go somewhere at least a couple of times before I leave a review. We've tried this place a few times & they just don't have it. From the slow service, DIRTY menus & dirty flatware (IF you get them before your meal & don't have to get them yourself like we've had to, TWICE). To my meal coming out wrong a couple times and the super long wait, to the point I don't eat because my wife & children are done & waiting. Last week the Fryer was out French fries available), but NO ONE says anything until you are about to order (after the 20+ min wait to be seated). The Manager says there's a sign on the door (small printout that was blocked by WAITING patrons). The TWO young ladies who were hostesses didn't say a word when taking our name OR while seating us (without flatware & napkins). We still order & wait & wait, then our food is cool AGAIN. After the usual oh, "I'm sooo sorry" & a long wait, my wife ate her burger, but I like mine hot & I did NOT eat dinner. AGAIN. Just go anywhere else & save the hastle of the "Red Robin Lottery". You might get a halfway decent meal, or you may not get one at all.
I was a little hesitant going from the recent not so great reviews, but was pleasantly surprised! Our waitress was great, food came out fast and was hot and correct.

The service here is typically hit or miss, but our service today was very underwhelming. We had a party of 7, and although the waiter initially acted as though he was eager to be helpful, it really fell off after we ordered. 5 of the 7 entrees came out and after he placed the food at the table, he looked at us and said "everyone got everything, right?" and began walking away. We had to call after him to let him know we were waiting on two more. We also asked for more fries and he assured us over and over "I got you, I got you" and went to the kitchen and loudly yelled our fry order, as if to overcompensate.. which was even more unfortunate because he never brought it out. After we ate it took a long time to ask for boxes, and then we told him we planned to pay with cash and he told us to use the device on the table and quickly walked off. It took another 5 minutes before he came by again and once more he told us to do everything through the device (???) and walked away. He eventually walked by and we just handed him the cash and left.  It's possible that the establishment was understaffed but the service was more lacking than usual.

Not impressed. Not satisfied. They took so long to make our order. Burger tasted just ok, edible, but the fries were not fresh, hot and crunchy. The only reason I might come back here is because they are open late.  We quickly forgot about this below average place as soon as we went to see Star Wars in AMC/IMAX theater nearby)) So the date was still good, even though the Supreme Leader and Luke Skywalker had to die to make it good.

This review is for Red Robin's pick up or "2 go" service. Attempted to do a pickup order on two different occasions, as our dining experience here is as to be expected for a chain restutant. 1st experience we decided to call in our order, an appetizer, 2 adult meals and a kids meal. For 1 of the adult meals a special request was made to exclude items from the meal, pretty typicasl and no hesitation from the order taker. Was quoted 20 minutes. I arrived 25 minutes later, and our meal wasn't ready. 15 minutes later they come out with the meal. I immediately check the special order, and it's wrong. So another 10 minutes to make it right. I was offered a free shake that I accepted for the trouble. After getting our meal and arriving home I learned that the other adult meal wasn't even what we asked for, I simply didn't check because it should have been straight forward. I called back and the Manager agreed to refund our meal onto a gift card and send it to us. I agreed. Never received the gift card. Our 2nd experience tonight I decided to do an online order that said my meal, special requests and all, would be done in 17 minutes. I arrived 25 minutes later and was told they were bagging up my order. 15 minutes later I had to ask again, finally my order came out, it was correct but the fries were cold. I was told it would take 10 minutes for new fries. Seriously!? You advertise everywhere bottomless fries, even McDonald's has fries on stand by at all times. While our typical experience at Red Robin is not the most amazing experience it is certainly better than what we received attempting their "2 go" service. Stick to dine in, expect typical chain restutant service, but hopefully the wait, order, and temperature of your food will be whats expected.

Unfortunately this place is horrible and won't be coming at this location.  We were not greeted at all by the waitress.  A really long wait for our food to come.  A couple of pieces of hair in our food.  No napkins.  Had limited silverware.  Very understaffed.  Too many red flags at this location, saddens me.

We came to Red Robin to get lunch one day and I ordered the whiskey river bbq burger and asked for a side salad instead of fries. When our food came out I noticed the salad looked funny, First I noticed the lettuce was not cut good at all, It was in really big pieces and did not look like something you'd expect to get from a restaurant. Then I noticed it had brown wilt marks all over the lettuce. Upon further inspection I just noticed there was a BUG on the lettuce! I almost would have ate it if I had not been examining it. I was so disgusted that I almost ate this bug. I told the waitress I wanted fries instead since my salad had bugs in it! So she brought the fries and notified the manager. Manager apologized and said they threw the salad out and if we wanted anything else. We said we'd have a dessert that was on the house for the mishap and she also took $10 off the bill. It was a nice gesture but still it sucks that their food quality was so poor that they would serve not fresh food, I'm just glad I didn't eat it.

This place always has great service and friendly staff and some of the best food. I can't get enough of the Banzai Burger... The pineapple and Teriyaki mixed with a little ketchup is like a Mardi Gras in my mouth! I'm getting excited thinking about this right now... And it's only 7 am. Love the bottomless fries and their onion rings are pretty awesome as well. I wish they would do unlimited onion rings and fries but I know that will never happen. :-)

I seem to have a problem every time I go here.  I'm thinking of just heading into concord next time my son wants to go here.  Waited 40 minutes for our food to come....I walked out.  I had an hour and a half to have lunch before my oncologists appointment. So much for that.  Had to wait to eat until after my appointment.  We had an empty soda glass and an empty beer bottle at the edge of the table, and our waiter walked passed it time and time again.    There were maybe 5 other tables occupied when we came in....there was no reason to wait 40 minutes for a BLT and a salad.   When I asked the waiter for a status on our order I was told it would be out when it was ready.  Not really the answer I was looking for.  So we paid for our drinks and left....and won't be back.

3.5 stars.  all staff were great.  very courteous, attentive and helpful.  what makes this place great, is the kids menu.  there are quite a few options for protein; chicken skewers, pizza, mac and cheese, etc.  but the kids get unlimited sides!  corn, broccoli, fries, apples and more!.  kids menu includes drink.   my wife had turkey burger which said was good.  i had the avocado cobb salad which comes with chicken.  ingredients were fresh.  im not a fan of the steak fries.  will try sweet potato fries next time.  onion rings were good.  will definitely be back!

I have mostly always had a great meal experience here it this location. Weather with family or with the girls. This experience was myself and my kids. We ordered the PRETZEL BITES w/caramel and also w/cheese. YUMMO!! We really enjoyed them with the caramel. Warm salty lil bites and sweet caramel is such a great mixture! The nacho cheese was nasty though. Yuck. Would totally advise you NOT to get the cheese. I don't even think it was actually the queso cheese used on their VooDoo fries. Something different. I ordered a red Spanish sangria and the Big Pig Out Tavern burger w/sweet potato fries. Sweet potato fries are an additional cost if you don't want the unlimited steak fries. Its 2 patties with 2 bacon pieces and bacon aioli! Typical fixins and American cheese. Man was it a big burger! Meat was made to my liking (med. rare) and the fries were hot and freshly prepared.  Kid #1 got the Reds burger and #2 got cluck-a-doodles (chicken tenders). Ryan was our server. He has great customer service and is very attentive.

If you want to get food poisoning, come eat here. My wife and I had the worst case of food poisoning. Why would you get food poisoning, because of unsanitary and safe food practices. They serve old food with bacteria. This place has a history of this. Eat at your own risk.

Avoid.  Went here with a buddy for a burger dinner. Waited 10 mins to get approached/greeted, then the manager ended up taking our order. I emphasized that I was a big fan of the "bottomless fries" even. 30 mins later, we finally got our meals, I wasn't offered more fries etc. We tipped, but accordingly to go with the dismal service. One might expected better from a restaurant's GM. Lesson learned.

Came here this evening, sat in the bar. Jasmine was our server. It took about 10 mins before she came by since it seemed like she was one of the only servers in the bar. She took our drink/food order. I asked for her recommendations on both my drink and my sandwich. The Zombie cocktail tasted like it was made with a mix, and it wasn't very good, but Jasmine was nice enough to replace it. My Bruschetta Chicken sandwich and my husband's burger were yummy, but like previous visits, both of our fries were just lukewarm. Jasmine was very good at checking back, and getting napkins, drinks, etc...

This place is bomb but they MUST get it together with the "bottomless fries" they only serve like 8 French fries at a time and take forever to bring out the next tiny batch of fries. Burgers are delicious!

Our visit was pleasant up until our food came out. Our server although new to the job was excellent. We ordered one of the Avo-Cobb salads similar to the one in the menu with lots of avocado and other fixings to match its name. Then the plate came out with a pair of slices from a baby avocado paired with tons of salad mix and a decent chicken breast. When asked for a few extra slices of avocado we were informed it would be an added charge. When asked to have the picture match the plate the manager informed us they serve each plate with 1/4 of an avocado per plate.  Please be the judge for yourself of their replacement plate offering compares to their own advertising. See picture Avo-Cobb ad vs reality.

USED TO BE: Our favorite spot cause of the PRICES of Happy Hour. They went up $2.50 per drink. There menus are filthy with food. I had to go to my car to get my baby wipes to clean table & menus. My sister & i would go there for 2 years, NO MORE.

I want to love this place cuz they have certain foods I do love, BUT this location can't seem to get it right. Once ordered a delish chicken salad to go- next time I ordered same thing the chicken wasn't fresh or hot, was refrigerated in diff type of container! Not impressed. Dining in a few weeks ago they served me a soda in a DIRTY GLASS! When I mentioned it tasted funny or off- waitress realized it wasn't clean! Yuck! Unacceptable. Also came in for special occasion celebration- served everyone else- forgot my meal. Had to make it and didn't get to eat till everyone else was done! Talk about uncomfortable! And didn't ever discount the meal any of the times! Have written to customer service with NO reply ever! Several times given us burgers with or without something in them we ordered, always screws food up, consistently. How hard is it to get the order right at this location?

Today I  wanted to try the Fish & Chips so to my Surprise, when I bit into the Fish, I found a long strand of HAIR IN IT!  (NOT MINE) So,  I told the waiter what happened,  the Manager offered another Order of Fish & Chips Or order Something Else on the Menu & said  " I GOT IT!" THAT HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE ALREADY, PUT A BAD TASTE IN MY MOUTH!  So,  I had to get something else. The Waiter never came back to check on  us after that incident.  He didn't refill my Hubby's soda or our Bottomless Fries, and my hubby even  paid extra for the Garlic Fries. The Manager came by to check how the Meal was,  but,  it really wasn't what I wanted to eat! The Manager asked if I wanted Dessert, and I said NO! Good thing we didn't get it. Because they probably would have billed us for that, as well.

It has been a while, since, I have been to Red Robin. Because, I felt the service had gone down hill.  The food and especially the soda machine. Always water down drinks. So, I went yesterday. I have to say, since they remodeled. The service was outstanding, food and now the carbonation for the soda was on point. And I see why, the manger was as outstanding as his employees. Working being a team player. Even in the kitchen. Leading by example. One word for Red Robin. Outstanding Service!!!
This place is ok for a burger spot. Their milkshakes are pretty good. The burgers are ok. The fries are ok as well

The burger didn't taste like an original Red Robin burger and heir fries were soggy. I was disappointed because I love Red Robin burgers. Their service wasn't too great either. Not thrilled about this location.

Me & my boyfriend come here at least 3-4 times a months. We just love burgers & we have great service every time. The best server is Marco-Pollo (pretty sure its just his nickname) & he is always very friend yet seems overworked.  Still, I love the burgers here & will keep coming back.

Don't come to this restaurant on a day where you're really hungry because you'll be expected to wait 40 minutes for your food. The service here is very slow. I was seated quickly and the man who greeted me and my party was very friendly but from there, the rest of the experience went downhill. We had two waitresses, both of whom made ordering a bit difficult and confusing when it shouldn't be. After waiting a long time for the food to finally arrive, the bacon on my sandwich was ice cold and they charged me for avocado yet one half had no avocado on it while the other had two small little chunks which, in my opinion is not worth being charged for. The fries didn't taste all that fresh either. The best thing about this meal was the milk shake as it was super good but that's not enough to really make this a good experience for me. I would have said something about my meal but the service was just too slow to risk sitting there even longer, so I decided not to make a fuss. I had chosen this location due to it's convenience but I'd rather drive farther to a better location, to be honest.  Won't be eating here again.

I love the food at Red Robin but it makes me so upset that every time I come here the service is terrible. They forgot to call our name, the forgot our appetizers and details of our order. I don't expect any discount or something free but how about an apology. Cross the street and go B.J's.

I'm so silly. I actually didn't know that Red Robin did take out. DURR ALEXA DURR Even was surprised that there was one outside of Sunvalley Mall? AGAING DURR ALEXA DURR Walking on in making the hostess feel weird when I instantly start taking pictures. Two grown women. One immediately says that she isn't hungry and the other, again, is taking pictures and checking her apps for updates and what-not. Despite all that, the hostess was kind and directed me to the bar (HEY NOW) when I told her that I was gonna order to go. Apparently, when you order to go, you'll be by the bar and you'll order your meal through the bartender.  Bartender was super nice. Gave me the menu. Obviously I was into getting a burger, but what kind of burger? Do I take the chili cheese burger? Do I go grab this Philly like cheese steak burger? Then my eye caught this Guac Bacon burger. Told myself that this was the healthy option among the burgers and ordered it. The bartender told me that it would take about fifteen minutes or so before my food was ready. That didn't happen. It take about seven minutes flat. He was surprised at how fast it came out, and I was surprised how fast it came out. As we walked out of the restaurant, I inwardly hoped that the food wasn't a mess and underdone because of how quick it came out of the kitchen. Guac Burger essentials: gauc, bacon, patty, swiss cheese, tomatoes, lettuce, onions, and mayo. Normally this wouldn't sound good to me. BUT I was hungry. So bite after bite I went through the burger. It's a big burger. The size was impressive. Even the amount of fries that they gave me was good. But the patty was a bit well done and I had asked for it to have more pink in it. There was hardly any guac in the burger too. I barely even tasted it. There was nothing in this item that amazed me. It was just another burger that I would eat because I was hungry. It wasn't something I would try again. The fries too had issues. Sure, there were a lot of fries. But that's no excuse for how lukewarm and even cold some of them were.  3/5: burger was alright, finished it, fries bad, service excellent, price meh.

5/5 stars for Shelby who handled my takeout order.  She was very friendly and courteous.   I'm giving 2/5 stars for this review because of the food.  Got takeout again and the Prime Chophouse burger was my usual favorite.  The meat this time was a little too salty.  The fries didn't taste fresh.  It was soggy.  The best thing was the one small piece of onion ring that came with the burger.  The onion ring was crispy and tasty.

I've attempted to eat at this restaurant on multiple occasions. Every visit was worse than the last.  Service here is awful. The last time I went to Red Robin at this location was the end of my attempts. After waiting at the front door without being greeted for around 5 minutes, a rushed young man approached and said "Two?" we replied "Yes." We were then told "How about the bar...it's open seating. Sit where you want." We told the guy we preferred a booth. He stomped off and said "This way." Then he proceeded to slap the two menus on a table while he kept walking. Wow. After 10 minutes of sitting at a table being ignored and not even offered drinks, we left.  Training would be a fabulous idea at this location. If my employees treated customers the way this punk treated us, I'd fire them on the spot.

Tried the smoke and pepper burger, it was pretty good. The presentation and quality has gone downhill in the past year. This place used to be really good but now it's just barely competing with its competitors.

My first time in a Red Robin in 20 plus years and still much the same except for the prices. It isn't fair to rate this against a full menu restaurant as it is essentially a burger place and makes no pretense of being otherwise. I appreciated the friendly greeting and goodbye from the manager and our waiter was prompt and courteous. Food was on the table ten minutes after ordering and was tasty and fresh. The Arctic cod on a bun had adequate additions to make it interesting and the teriyaki chicken burger was equally tasty.  This is not the place to go on a low cal diet so only go if you are really hungry.

location: Central San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: If I could give this place zero stars I would absolutely horrible. My girl friend and I went to grab a quick bite and when we came in close to empty completely staffed. As soon as we sat down it took almost about 20 minutes to even get someone to come to our table. The whole time we watched them all (at least 10+ servers) huddled up chit chatting eating and drinking beverages when we had yet to be helped. We had probably made eye contact with our then server about 5x. The management is just as slow as the servers. Completely unprofessional I will NEVER be back!! If these young workers don't want to have a job they should not work here!!

yesterday my son chose this place after being really good at his physical therapy (he's 4) and everything was fine paid for the dumb game and told him he could get whatever he wanted...The waitress was sweet and fast... . But we were seated between two different couples both discussing their custody of their kids and both got pretty heated. Like cursing and bringing up old fights and at one point a dad stormed out and never came back ...Here I am trying to color and play with my son with all this negative arguing and I don't care who cheated Rebecca it's still his daughter too. TAKE THAT SHIT TO DENNYS LADIES AND GENTLEMEN THIS IS A CLASSY PLACE smfh....

Came in for last 15 mons of happy hour, and our server knew it so he made sure we got in our order before it ended. The food was great and everything came out quickly. Really good service for a chain, and really good food. Don't know if this place is only one to do it but they have sections for people who are over 21, and then sections that are for people of all ages. Random, but it works.

The place was literally jam packed as far as could be legal by fire codes standards. We arrived later than we would have liked (6:45 pm) but I wanted to see how it would be when it's actually truly busy. 25 minutes to be seated + 7 minutes for server to come to our table + 12-15 minutes for order to come = reasonable enough wait experience for time of day. The manager had called me the week prior to apologize for the issues we had with wait and poor quality. They took reasonable steps to encourage us to give it another try. Our server was Kim and she went out of her way to accommodate us. Both managers, Bill and Steve(?), even helped. I saw them moving around the restaurant floor helping different tables so I won't assume it was just us they were trying to please (though perhaps a little more intently due to my previous review).  What helped greatly was that we ordered our food to be brought out all at once and with the extra fries as well (as suggested by Bill). We also specified the condiments at that time. Not sure if it was the way we ordered, the server or the manager's knowledge of my previous review but things moved rather quickly. It may have been all of the above.  Overall it was a descent experience. My husband and I both ordered the whiskey river chicken and sandwich and our eldest son the burger version. I didn't much like the my sandwich but that's my own preferential issue. It was seasoned enough. Our eldest "LOVED" his mean and our other two enjoyed their pizza and grilled cheese sandwich bites. Husband said he liked the hamburger patties version of the whiskey river over the chicken sandwich version. That's all. Hope this helps someone in their own decision futuristically. BTW, ALWAYS call in advance so you're prepared for a possible long wait time.

Service is terrible. We ordered online. Order was not ready even after an additional 15 minutes. The restaurant was dirty- they had no bussers tonight according to several employees. It was apprentice. But it's always disgusting in here. Case and point; the front to go counter which is littered with dirty napkins. Corporate needs pay this place a visit && so does the county health inspector. I asked to speak with a manager and he blew me off

Red Robin is Red Robin. They have bottomless fries, they got hamburger's and they got strawberry freckled lemonade.  They have tried to bring this restaurant into the 21st century and provide better service by installing these tablet like devices that you can order food from or summon your server or see what you are ordering before you get it, which is nice. They used to let you play the trivia games against other tables but now they charge you for that which sucks but hey that's capitalism.  They added sweet potato fries which is good for all you gluten free folks and lettuce wrap any burger which is great for low carb people.  I never really go out of my way to come to RR but when they send us a buy one get one 50% of coupon and I get a hankering for a burger I'll make my way down here.

It took about 10 minutes of standing around until someone finally seated us. After they seated us we told them that are table was covered with food and crap. It took about 15 minutes until are table was cleaned. Then about 30 minutes later they finally decided to acknowledge that we were there and took our order. Another 30 minutes went by and they finally gave us our food but unfortunately our order was completely incorrect. It took another 45 minutes until we are able to tell them that our order was incorrect they did nothing to help us out and we are never going back to this location because the service sucks they are lucky that we even paid and did not walk out.  IN-N-OUT was much better.
Great service for our big group, with food just as it should be. It's a busy location, so give yourself plenty of time.

I ate dinner at the Red Robin in The Streets in Brentwood.  The dinner was very good.  I had the Avo Cobbo salad with griled chicken on top, guac salsa and chips, and a bowl of Red's Chili.  The salad was great.  I had bleu cheese dressing which was great.  There wasn't much guacamole with the chips but it was good.  The chili was tasty but was a surprise to me.  It was mostly ground beef with shredded cheese, chopped red onions, and just a few black beans.  It was more like nachos beef than chili.  It was very tasty but I was more interested in traditional chili since I had a serving of meat (chicken) on the salad.
Tonight I picked up dinner. My fiancee ordered her burger with the garlic herb fries and they were very cheap in giving fries plus hardly any garlic flavor.

Just waited for 5 maybe 10 minutes standing there with nobody to seat us ! 2 people looked at me and walked away . The place had no one there either ! Maybe 2 or 3 tables total ! Maybe it is because 2 of our party have dreads or something ! But trust me they have money ! Bad service ! Or should I say a major absences of service ! Noooo good red Robbin ! Very rude !

Came in for lunch today & although it was pretty busy on a Saturday, we were seated quickly & our server greeted us promptly! Drinks came out fast & although we took a look at while to figure out what we were ordering, our fold came out in a decent amount of time. My cod burger was warm, although I wish it would have come out hot. The bottomless fries were awesome, I got the sweet potato fries & I was in love!! They're so good & those also come out very quickly, and so do the refills!

After going here on two different occasions for dinner and taking more than an hour just to get our food. On top of our food being cold. The second time I talked to a manager to let them know that we will not be coming back. Our order was simple; kids meatballs, BBQ burger and chicken tenders and fries, there is zero reason the tenders should be cold it's the easiest thing. He insisted on giving us a gift card to give them another chance.  So today I took my little one to lunch thinking it would be better. Everything came out quickly and correctly and our server was wonderful. However third bite in, I notice PUBE HAIR on my mushrooms. Probably beard hair either way. DONE! The manager offered fries, uh no thanks, just grossed out. Checked the kids food it was fine and she was happy. I wish this wouldn't have happened because I honestly like the menu. What the heck Red Robin! ****Hire or train your expos better already!!!!!****THIS COULD HAVE BEEN AVOIDED

We've had some good dinners here with my better half's parents, but the last two times I've been here we're really disappointing. Fries and burger were cold (not warm) and the specialty bleu burger was basically two nice pieces of bread with a spoonful of toppings and a room temperature thin patty. Two times in a row now I've ordered of their "high-end" burgers and it's less than some low end fast food drive thru. We would've done better just getting In N Out. Waitress brought an order of hot sweet potato fries, but too little too late. My kids did better, but my son's pizza slice was also cold and he woke up having had a major accident first thing in the morning--only to have it happen a second time with a whole new set of clothes just before we left for school. My stomach was squirmy all morning today too.
Went on a Monday evening after hearing some mixed review. Service was excellent!  Food was as ordered and on time!, even though all waiters were busy and most tables taken. Kuddos to Marco our server

The only reason I come here is for the gluten free hamburger buns. The service here is terrible, there is a serious lack of organization which causes the service to be very slow. We also ordered the spinach artichoke dip one time and there was a piece of plastic in the dip, disgusting! I think this is a good place to take children but if you want good and quick service then don't come here.

As we walked in the hostess greeted us right away and hinted for us to sit at the bar area. As we walked into the car it was a nice treat! It had plenty of tables and different variations of seating ranging from booths, counters and standard tables.  Our waiter came and took down our orders which were the Black and Bleu burger garlic fries , the Marco Pollo burger with sweet potato fries, and the shorty o-ring.  While we wait for our order to came a small appetizer of Fries came which were delicious! We loved the seasoning on it and it was impossible to stop and take a picture. Then came the shorty o-ring which was just as equally delicious! We enjoyed the campfire sauce and the each sauces they came with. After devouring these items the final presentations came!  The black and Bleu burger with garlic fries was delicious! However the fries were too oily to consume in one sitting. The Marco Pollo burger was also amazing, it had a delicious chipotle sauce and the chicken was perfectly grilled. However the sweet potato fries were too salty, I did ask to get them remade and they didn't put salt on them. Which was kinda disappointing, I  just wanted less salt, if you see in the picture they had huge chucks of salt.  Overall great experience but we most likely won't be coming back, it's not our usual cup of tea and all the oily food made us bloated the rest of the night :(

Went with some friends that were visiting from out of town and we had the worst service ever. Let me rephrase that, it was the worst food ever. the poor teenage waiter did what he could to keep us happy despite the kitchens mishaps. first they forgot to bring out our appetizer of wings and onion rings, then to make it up he brought baskets of cold burnt fries and explained the manager would comp our appetizers. When our food came, the kids burgers were missing. when they finally came out my poor kids said they tasted like charcoal, upon examining the burger it looked like they were chewing on hockey pucks. Dont know what happened tonight guys, it was very disappointing. and to say the least, the manager not once came to our table to apologize. Terrible, just terrible.

Food is still great but the wait for food has been getting longer.  The last time I visited, our party walked out because the food took longer that an hour.  We are now approaching 30 minutes and still. I appetizer.  It's Sunday and this place is not even halfway full.  I'm less likely to visit places that can't deliver within the half and hour time frame for appetizer or food.

Good  burgers BUTwhy is it so hard to get hot fries with your meal ?  I ask for hot fries out of the fryer responses will try and they still come out warm.  I give up trying to get hot fries anymore from here .

I have come to the conclusion that all Red Robins are the same. I have been to 3 different locations, each and every single one of them are the same. One is no longer open and who knows what will happen to the other two!  We had a new waitress who was training, but she had someone walking around with her. If he is the one that is doing the training and he is forgetting certain items as well, then she is going to be in trouble.  I had ordered broccoli instead of french fries. Order came with fries. Once delivered I had brought it to there attention and they acted like it was news to them. The trainer said he would get the broccoli for me. A few minutes later the new waitress said that the broccoli was coming. Needless to say, 30 minutes later the broccoli never showed up!  Another thing that irritates me is how long the tables stay dirty for. The same group of tables stayed dirty the whole time we were there, which was a little over an hour. If you are a server, you can make more money if you clean your own tables as well to get more people sitting there.  My last pet peeve with all RR's is: They have these new things on the table where you can order food and drinks. However you have to wait for the server to turn it on for you to do so. Every waiter or waitress will ask if you want any appetizers. Then they tell you to order them on the new table gadget. Whats the point of asking, if they are then going to tell you to do it on the table gadget but they have to turn it on for you.  Don't expect great service. Just expect a meal that might be what you actually ordered.

If I could give this place a zero, I would. Waited for half an hour to get our burgers. When we got our burgers, the meat patty was cold (nasty). I don't know what happen to this place but it definitely has gone downhill. I'm still here at (Red Robin's) writing this review and has been waiting for the manager to come talk to us for the last 20 minutes. Worst experience yet at this Red Robin's. Might not be on your budget but invest and HIRE more help and you might get better reviews!

So I'm updating my review from 08/17/2016 as I said I would pending a response from their management. The Kitchen Manager Erick D. messaged me back today and  wanted me to contact him, to go over what our experience was the day of the review. After talking to him he invited us back to give them another shot. So here's what happened... When we arrived we asked to talk to Erick but I guess he was busy in the kitchen and the acting GM Matt came out to greet us. It was a Sat night and the place was busy. I wasn't too concerned about what our service was going to be like because we were invited to come back so I figured that they would take very good care of us. We arrived approx 6:10 PM and were sat by 6:14. The whole process took about about 45 mins from there, we were out the door and on our way by 7 pm. Matt checked on us several times and eventually Erick came by to introduce himself. All in all, it was a good experience the food came out prompt and our server Kadisha, Di Di for short (sorry if I butchered the spelling Kadisha) was very nice and attentive. We had very good service. The whole time I was looking around to see what everyone else's service was like. Here's what I noticed... Our server Kadisha was very attentive to ALL of her tables, she would do a quick scan and clear plates and get refills before people drinks got too low. Matt did check on us a few times but he was also checking on everyone else in our section. The Hostess staff were constantly walking in our area and setting up table or double checking them to make sure they could seat people promptly. The bus staff was on point clearing tables when patrons would leave. It didn't seem like anyone in our area was waiting around for their food to come out of the kitchen, so I could assume the kitchen staff was in there rocking it. All this would tell me that last Wednesday was just an off day. 4 Stars because I am a fan of Red Robin, the wife and I really do enjoy the food and their fun atmosphere. The 5th star for the effort the management put in to rectify our past experience. I realize that there will be bad days but thank you for caring enough to change at least one Yelper's dining experience. Much appreciated, we'll be back.

This was the worst experience ever at the Brentwood sand creek location!! The The service sucked and when I asked for the salad it took one hour to get here!! I ordered the avo cabo salad and it didn't come with any avocado but a side of guacamole (wow) when I asked where was the avocado, the server said , we have a shortage of avocado and we won't be able to give you any!! Also I wasn't given any silverware and when I asked , where is my napkin and fork to eat , the server said oh hold on ...and 15 minutes later comes back with it!! The lettuce was limp, old  and the bread was burnt, what worse service can you get!! I am very disappointed and never will I return here until it is under new management!!?

Food was delicious once we got it which is the only reason for two stars.  Took 20 min for someone to greet us after we were seated and take our order. Three other tables seated after us had their drinks before we met our server Austin. The appetizer sat under the heat lamp and was delivered with the meal. Austin was quicker to provide the check than he was to take our order. We saw him twice to take our order and deliver the check. Other servers brought our food. Very disappointed and they weren't even busy.

I have always liked Red Robin...the one in Concord. Every time we come to this one, (honestly, I don't know why we keep giving them chances) the service is slow, the food is cold or they mess up our order. This evening we came, we were seated immediately. The hostess wasn't the most friendliest either. She tried though, I guess.   There was probably a total of 5 groups (including us) in the dining area (not including the bar). So needless to say, they were slow. When the waitress came to take our drink order, we had enough time to look over the menu by that time so we just ordered our drinks, appetizer and meals all at the same time. While sipping on our drinks, we kept looking around cause time was passing and we still hadn't received our appetizer. After probably a good 45 min, our meal finally came out. That's right....no appetizer yet. Our meals looked thrown together. Our fries were cold and looked as if they were leftovers from someone else's plate (something of a common occurrence when coming here. Why do we keep coming??!! Smh). My husband ordered the egg burger, over easy but it came out over hard. It wasn't until our meals were almost done that the appetizer finally came. The gal that brought it felt bad and asked if we still wanted it. My husband didn't want to accept it but the gal said she would talk to the manager about getting it removed off our bill. We went ahead and took it. Then our waitress said she had spoken with the manager and they offered 50% off. Really?!  Lame. The tip calculator is wrong on the ziosk thing. It adds the tax in when it shouldn't (picture included). Since we weren't happy with this experience, my husband signed the check the way he really feels!! Yeah, picture included for this too!!  Typically we are more forgiving with some of these types of issues but when it's EVERY TIME, I think it's time to put this on the "NEVER AGAIN" list of restaurants.
Good food! I love their guacamole bacon burger/ and chicken version of the same. Just tried the fish and chips and they were awesome! Lots of variety.

Came here for lunch with my mom and was quite impressed with the quality and taste of our food. I ordered the bruschetta chicken sandwich and thought it was filling and flavorful! My only complaint is how long the food took to come. It was lunch time on a Tuesday and definitely not packed. The restaurant itself seemed clean and our waiter was attentive.

Love this place. Great Burgers... I loving taking friends and the grand-kids. The  staff is always so nice. The food and drinks are always good. Tried the barbecue  chicken sandwich last week. It was wonderful.

After eating here tonight tonight I left feeling like I ate at a fast food restaurant.  Our server had the personality of a wet sponge.  Which means no personality.  Our entree's came with chicken but we had to ask for knives.  My husbands burger came out missing items that would make it a sriracha burger over a cheese burger.  That was brought to the servers attention and he asked my husband to check 'under the meat'.  Nope nothing there.  I had a salad that says it comes with garlic bread, that wasn't on the plate.  I had water (which tasted a little off)  and was never offered a re-fill nor was my husband offered a refill on his ice tea.   My husband was never offered or asked if he wanted more  fries.  On reviewing the bill we noticed that we'd been charged for two Sriracha burgers.  One would think that this young man would have been  trained before being put on the floor.  But if he was 'trained' I won't recommend this place or try again.  The restaurant in Sun Valley sucks too and hoped the Brentwood one would be better.  With so many other restaurants in our area RR is off our list.
Finally made it to the main dining room, too noisy, going back to the bar... burger was awesome!
The staff is friendly and you get your food exactly as you'd ask. Special shout out to our bartender Tony and Maddie for recognizing us as regulars. That was really cool.

After over a year of going here, (mostlybecause the boyfriend loves it). I'm done.  They never get my order correct.  The waitress even brought the wrong drink for me and tried to charge me for it.   I do not understand why it's so hard to just get something the way you order it.   Red Robin definitely doesn't know how to show consistent service.

We finally decided to give this place another chance to see if they improved. I must say, they were much more attentive to service. They had 3 hosts that greeted us right away which was a huge change from before and our server was very friendly and helpful. We will be back and hope they stay consistent -- I am reserving 4/5 stars if they do well again on our next visit.

Every time I have placed a to-go order (at least once a month), I have to call 3 times until someone finally picks up.  There have been several times I just give up and order elsewhere.   One time while waiting in the bar area to pick up my food I watched as the phone rang and rang and the manager totally ignored it until a customer asked if she was going to answer it.

Our waitress was very nice and personable, but the food was horrible. My boyfriend and I ordered the same thing crispy chicken sandwhiches, and garlic fries. When our order was brought out, they had the completely wrong plate of food for my bf, and when they swapped out the chicken patty, they brought him regular fries. While I was looking at my plate while they swapped his, my chicken patty was a joke. BURNT, DRY, AND HARD. My fries were greasy as hell and limp. Not one piece of garlic or parsley, and literally 5 shreds of parmesan cheese lol. Will never be coming back again. More than half the restaurant was empty, no excuse for such poor food to be put out. We'll stick to the Concord and San Jose locations! This location needs a new management and kitchen staff ASAP
I had a horrible service over 30 min wait , server never attend to us , restaurant always dirty. I mean literally the worse service ever I wouldn't even Red Robin again in my life time.

Had dinner at this location for the first time yesterday. There were seven of us. It didn't take long to get seated, but once seated everything seemed to take a while.  Our waiter didn't come to our table for quite a bit, he was very nice but nothing was explained to us. We didn't know we had to use the "Ziosk" to place  our appetizer order, refills, or even pay our bill. He said he only takes the main order .  We placed our appetizer order, but he still had to help us because neither of the two ziosks were working properly, very poor system. When our appetizers came they didn't give us plates and you couldn't get anyone to stop to ask for them. Besides, anytime we asked for anything it seemed as though they wouldn't come back for about 10-15 minutes. As for the appetizer, don't bother with the chips, guacamole and salsa. The serving of the guacamole is about 2 tablespoons. I had to laugh that one off. The onion rings and fried pickles were ok. We order our main dishes, peppercorn burger, southern charm burger, jalapeño burger, chicken tenders and shrimp, and chicken salad. It was okay. Definitely not the same quality of food from when we use to go to the Sunvalley Mall location years ago.  Overall, I didn't leave there with wanting to go back.  I was disappointed, I remember how good their burgers use to be.

Very very disappointed with Red Robin. My wife, son and I went to Red Robin to get a quick bite to eat. We haven't been there for about 2 years and we were really hungry. We placed our orders and got our onion rings first. The onion rings were really good. Not burnt. My wife ordered the fish and chips cause she gave up beef for lent and I got a bacon burger. We both had bottomless French fries but I paid a little extra so I can get the garlic one.  My wife bit into her fish and out came a long strand of hair. Not hers and we told the waiter about it. The manager over heard us and he came over asking her if she would like another order of fish or something else off the menu. She eventually ordered the 4 cheese melt. The waiter never came back to see how we were doing. Never refill our fries or refill my soda. The manager finally came to us and ask her if she liked what she ordered then he asked us if we wanted dessert. We said no..Good thing because when we got our bill, he took off the fish and chips but her 4 cheese melt was on the bill. Had we got the dessert, that would have been on that bill too. Isn't it a norm that if you found something foreign in your meal that you get the replacement for free? He told my wife that it's only $6 bucks. That's not the point. He then decides to give her a $5.00 gift card to come back. Hahahahahaha..I don't think so!!!

My office had lunch from here yesterday, including myself, we had 20 orders - to Go!  Everything was present and accounted for (less one sauce) and delicious!  Servers were friendly and the service was timely, even though I called it in the same morning I picked it all up.  Price was in line and I'm glad we picked it.  We'll be back.
They are to slow saw the waiter walking from one table to another and slip us and getting the order all mixed up

Long over due! Here goes nothing, HaHa! That's exactly what you get nothing, waiting for nothing, Staff knows nothing! What in the He Double Hockey Stick!   I got the funnies!  No! Fo real though Board Meeting!!!  Get it together... By the way! 2 star only because I get my same booth every time on bar side!  All dwn hill from there unless the stars align, which seems to be Wednesday!

3 1/2 stars really. Overall, burgers is what they do best. We'll stick to that when we come in again. They seem to have issues with their service, some days worse than others, but the managers are very quick to fix any problems you might be having. I may sound old when i say this but it's just too hard to find Millennials who care about the job their doing. We see this everywhere. The "I don't give a shit" attitude just bugs the F out of me, but what can you do?  Eat at home more i guess.  Anyway, i digress. Red robin, is a burger place, and as long as i remember that, i will not be dissatisfied.  Oh and by the way, if your going to have "bottomless"  fries, then please don't give them to me 10 at a time and make me beg for them every 5 minutes, that's just rude, and borders on false advertising...just sayin'.
Cindy was great! For a Friday night, or food was quick, but more importantly, delicious! I had the new Colussus which was awesome. She took care of the kids as well! Great Place!

Gross! A month's worth of food in the bench and all over the cushions when they sat us... we had to ask to get it cleaned, hostess came back with one dry napkin (she got the cushions, but saved what's in the bench for you???  Ordered the Cesar Wrap and it came out with mostly wrap clumped together with a toothpick... when I asked the waitress about it, she agreed it looked way wrong and brought another.  So what bothers me is that they seem to know what's wrong... but won't do anything about it until you say something!  I actually like the food and menu, but there are serious issues here (sadly since they opened) with service, cleanliness and quality/ attention to detail!

Just based on the phone call I made there; I probably won't frequent this particular location as much anymore only because the service experience for me has gone downhill.  I would rather much drive a few more minutes further to the Concord location for better service

Where do I begin this place deserves no stars slow, slow, slow waited 40 min for food which wasn't that great; turkey burger & fish with fries very little fries given had to ask for more there is no urgency for customer service. The tables are to close together you feel as if you are sitting with the family next to you. My experience has been nothing spectacular I would rather go to the Counter in Walnut crk. Better food, better hamburger's and way better service I guess you get what you pay for don't bother going here the food will upset your stomach no fun....

Years ago when my kids were little I loved Red Robin for a casual meal.  Then they replaced all of their lights with LED's and they put in so many it was as bright as  an operating room, it would give me a headache, and so we stopped going.  2 weeks  ago my daughter asked if we could go to Red Robin for dinner and I agreed to give it another chance.    First, I was happy to see that the lights had been toned down.  The restaurant was clean (and basically empty which isn't surprising on a weekday) . The waitress greeted us almost 10 minutes after we were seated and we ordered our drinks and an appetizer. Except she wouldn't order our appetizer, she said we had to use a machine on the table that was covered in fingerprints to order it, I didn't even want to touch it, it was gross. The waitress was super out of it.  My daughter never got her soda.  The waitress kept forgetting we existed.  She mostly spent her time chatting with someone by the kitchen. By the time we got our food it was cold.  She would  walk by to check on one of her other tables and then go "oh, oops!  I'll get you that soda" etc... and then forget us again. Maybe she was stoned? The hilarious part was when she told me I had to use the dirty machine to pay the check and then she asked me to please give her a perfect  review after paying the check because it would really help her.  We still had not received the boxes we requested or my daughters soda! A week after the disaster above my daughter asked if we could pick up burgers to-go after our hike.  She called the order in and they told us it would be ready in 15 minutes.  I arrived on time and waited 45 minutes longer for our food.  The bartender was awesome and apologized profusely and she really felt bad about it, but management should have stepped in.   There were 3 other groups of people with me waiting for their food to come out and others arriving. Bad service, cold food.
Love Red Robbin! Fast, friendly and all around great customer service from our server Mackenzie!

This particular Red Robin location is not worth the visit. On more than one visit my order has been wrong (just a regular non-customized order). My last visit I lost my appetite... and no longer wish to visit this location. The meat was bloody and RAW, the lettuce was brown and slimey, the bread bun was soaked through to a point that it was mush and didn't stay together. It was not at all edible AND the order wasn't even right. I really hate leaving bad reviews but that experience was ridiculous. Our server was surprised and just as disgusted as I was. Kitchen staff needs to be trained more. The only reason I am giving this location 2 stars is because the hosts/servers are usually really nice. Hoping this location will improve.

Automatic one star! I found a HAIR in my food! Disgusting. If someone's hair in the kitchen got into my food, I can't imagine how dirty it is back there and how the workers here fail to comply to health regulations for their diners here. So disappointed.. Service wasn't all that great either. No smile, no friendly talk, just hi what do you want do you need anything are you done. Definitely won't be coming back here... Yuck!

So at first our experience at Red Robin was less than satisfactory . I was with a group of six people and we waited to be waited on for at least 15 minuets to even be acknowledged. But when we were it was by a gentleman that was not suppose to be our server and our service from here on out was extraordinary. He was attentive to our drink and food orders and came back several times to check on the table . Thank you Hugo V for taking what would have been a bad experience and turning it around for us . And thank you Shelby the bartender is seriously the most attentive girl and best experience We've ever had while waiting for a table.

I have been here some many times in the last 3 years to have a drink with friends and a quick eat while in the bar. The main restaurant has some real issues. Many times the food is not warm and it can take a long time to get your food. There always seems to be new faces and the ones that have been there the longest are the only reason I believe the restaurant stays open.  Good place for a quick stop. Just don't think you will be done in time to catch the movie in 30 minutes.

The kids really wanted burgers today for lunch so we decided to give red robin one more chance.. Our experience was bad enough last time that we ended up walking out after waiting over 30 mins for drinks and no one had taken our order. It was busy today so I was skeptical but much to our pleasure, we were waited on by a very friendly guy named Tony and the service was awesome.  He kept our drinks filled at all times and brought more fries as soon as my son ate the last one. He was friendly, outgoing, funny and attentive. He really changed the way we thought about the place because as far as I was concerned we were never coming back. Now we will be back for sure, as long as Tony is working. Five stars for the service!

I've been to this location a number of times now and am yet to be impressed. With the exception of mine and my Husband's first visit here which was ''ok'' (not great but not terrible) every other one has been so bad I actually emailed corporate. Let's break this down: - Inconsistent food - Half of the staff could not care less. - Pick and choose which discounts and Birthday deals they honor. - All meals never come out at once. - Always over cook the Burgers.  - Place is always untidy (dirty plates left on unoccupied tables for long periods of time) Each visit here we found the food to be on the decline until one day we came in and I was served bad (as in foul tasting) Chicken. My Chicken Ensenada Platter came out way before my Husbands with the server stating that my Husbands was ''just coming''. Great.. we don't mind waiting but I had no cutlery to eat my meal with which is fine if it was a Burger but I'm not an animal, eating Chicken Breast and Salad with my hands just wasn't going to happen. We sat trying to get the servers attention for 10 minutes before she came back over. My Husbands meal still not in sight and mine now gone fairly cold. His meal came 8 minutes later (yes, I timed it). As for the food that visit.. yuk! My Chicken was rubbery with a foul taste and my Husbands ''Medium'' Burger was way over cooked to the point of being chewy and dry. We left saying that would be our last visit. However, after emailing corporate about the issues I got a call from the manager of this location offering me a gift card to return ''on him'' with hopes to impress us next time. He did state that when we go in we should say that we're returning after a poor experience. Did I? Hell no.. That's almost as bad as going into a restaurant telling staff you Yelp. It would also defeat the whole point as they would be likely to go out of their way to try impress only then to go back to the same crappy experience we had before.  I was right not to say anything either because although the experience was marginally better the food and service was still pretty bad. I've been to quite a few Red Robin locations and this is the worst so far. I miss the San Mateo location.

The manager of this restaurant reached out to me and profusely apologized for the inconvenience and explained that the restaurant was revamping their processes.  I appreciated his effort and as a result, I re-visited and had a great experience and great meals on many occasions.

One star, one word: Cleanliness. I made the mistake of sitting at the booth in the bar section where you can see EVERYTHING. From servers touching their faces/hair, to handling money and not washing their hands. Gross! We will not be back.
Not sure why they have drinks on their menu and they have discontinued them or run out of the ingredients to make them. Fail

Had lunch at this location. We walked in and was seated right away. We asked for napkins because the table and seats were dripping wet from being wiped off. After we got our drinks 15 minutes later, my wife said there was a ant on my arm. Odd I thought. So I killed it and went on with our conversation. Almost 45 minutes later we received our 2 burgers lukewarm and our fries cold. Between that time we killed a few more ants. After we got our food we saw the ants on the back side of the table. We kept trying to get our waiters or managers attentions no one came. So we started putting the ants on a napkin. Finally after we paid the Waiter came up and we asked for the manager. He apologized, and said he was going to quarantine the table. However, there was someone seated down right after we left. What a joke.

This is an update to my first review only.. After posting my yelp review I received a message from the complaint center at Red Robin.  They were concerned about my experience I had when we ate there. They discussed my review and were apologetic. They stated the review would continue to go up the chain of management and they would look into the quality of food they are putting out at the Brentwood, Ca Restaurant.   It nice to see that my yelp review could possibly make a small difference.  They also offered me a second chance to come in and try there food again. Through a gift card they sent me.  So, even though the food we had was not very good the Customer service was excellent. And for that reason I gave them a 4 star.

Today I went to eat lunch at Red Robin with my boyfriend. We arrived at 2:15pm on a Sunday afternoon and we had our order taken at 2:18pm.  7 minutes later, we received our water and Sprite. 45 minutes later, we received a lukewarm basket of fries and an apology from our waitress. 50 minutes later we received our two turkey burgers with fries, BOTH lukewarm. This waitress had 5 tables to serve. I hope this gives you an idea of what the service is like.  I would rate this service 0 stars, but this app requires at least 1 star.

The food here is great and the host seats you right away.  The down side is the long wait to get your food.  45 minutes to get our burgers.  That was just way too long.  I'll only come back again if I have no plans that day.

Came here for my daughters 7th birthday. We came as a party of 6. I ordered the Banzai burger which should have come with a beef patty but came with chicken. One of my daughters got a completely incorrect burger and my youngest daughter (bday girl) gagged on her mac and cheese  and received the wrong side. Our waitress was very nice but never asked if we needed refills on our bottomless drinks and fries. We also were never offered any dipping sauces. Everything that should have been offered to us we had to ask for instead. Very dissapointing experience. We went to Red Robin in Pleasanton last year and were very pleased. I will never return to this location.

Went to eat around 4 there was a small rush when we got there. We got seated in Shelby's section manager Steve came over and greeted us and took our drink and food order. Shelby never came by to introduce herself. Steve was awesome as a manager. He took care of our dessert since it took long. By the way the doughnuts are so good! Anyways if you get seated with Shelby hopefully she doesn't have too many tables to focus on. Thank you Steve for saving the day! I only gave 4 stars because we had Shelby. For Steve five stars!

The staff here is awesome!  We come here often and usually grab take out. Last night, I picked up an order, got home, and discovered it was the wrong order. I called, was immediately transferred to the manager, Steven. Again, what a great staff. He did me a solid, giving me a gift card worth over twice the bill. Love, love these guys!

Date: May 1, 2015  10 minute wait after being seated before our server came to take our order. Waited 28 minutes after our order was taken and when our food finally came out. (I noticed we weren't the only table looking grumpy at the long wait time for our meal. I saw at least 2 other tables questioning to themselves or their friends about where the server was and why the food was taking so long.)  Throughout the 28 minute wait (yes, I timed it), our server never once came over to tell us something along the lines of "I'll check on your food", "I'm not sure what's taking so long, let me look". Instead, a manager noticed our slightly unhappy demeanor as we were very hungry and came over to ask if maybe there was something wrong with the food. He was very considerate and immediately went to find out what happened to our meal. After asking our server, he came back to inform us that another server accidentally gave my dad's burger to another customer and we were waiting for another one to be made. As much as I appreciate the manager taking the time to let us know of the situation, I feel like it's part of the server's job to let us know. Unfortunately, I didn't happen to get the manager's name, but I really appreciated his concern and helpfulness!  I ordered the Buzz Clucks & Mac 'N' Cheese. I found the buzz clucks to be too intense in flavor. I couldn't taste the chicken. All I could taste was the overwhelming BBQ breading that surrounded the chicken. I was so grateful for the ranch sauce so I could smother it in ranch. It wasn't spicy, there was just too much breading that drew me away for the chicken. Originally I was assuming that it was being served as chicken tenders with either a BBQ dip on the side or had the sauce on it instead of a full-blown breading attack to the palette... On the other hand, I enjoyed the Mac 'N' Cheese that came with it. Super hot, temperature-wise, but delicious. I wouldn't order this again as much as I love Mac 'N' Cheese.  My dad ordered the Red's Big Tavern Burger with a Diet Coke. The burger was fine, seemed smaller than usual even though he ordered the larger portion. Typically, servers would ask if he would like a refill on his soda, but she never came to ask. He was disappointed in that as he tends to finish his drink quickly. (Yes, I know he could've asked, but seeing as we were both famished for not eating breakfast so we could watch The Avengers: Age of Ultron, we weren't exactly in an asking mood.)  Overall, food was just average. Not too thrilled about our server; she was nice but she also happened to disappear a lot when you needed her for something...  Note to the establishment: Please do something about the sticky menus! It's rather gross :(  Total: $25.79

Service is always so terrible! Love the food though! Tried to use the Ziosk a few times to call the server to pay my bill but took another waitress to come over in order for us to get the server to finally take care of us. Jasmine was our server and training a new person. I hope the trainee has a better trainer. In fact, had a $25 gift card from the last time our service and food was bad. Lesson learned. Not coming back.

Customer service from ASHLEY.... horrid!!!! Rude and disrespectful. If it wasn't for my daughter wanting to eat there for a birthday dinner we would not be going!! The manager was beyond kind! Ditch Ashley on the phone or any other contact with customers.

The customer service is very good however the amount of salt that they used in most of the dishes is way over-the-top I would suggest ordering extra water with whatever food you eat here. My wife had the French dip prime and I had the whiskey BBQ Burger which was really good just very salty.

I decided to try this particular RR, for the third time. It will be my last.  First time it took 10 min to even get noticed at the bar.  Then took about 45 min to get food.   Second time I came in, I sat at the tables in the bar , thinking I would get served faster.  Nope, it took about 10 min to get a waitress, then another 10 min to get my drink. I then waited about 15 min to order food, she never came back so I walked out. Third and final time was last Friday at 1:55pm.  We sat at bar and had to ask to order food after about 10 min. The food did not come out till 2:40.  Needless to say , the food is really good, but , I do not have an hour and a half to waste for lunch.

SLOW SERVICE! Omg horrible! They need to get in together!  It's Friday - lunch time and they have a full staff, why is it unbelievable slow?! I don't know!!! The food is good ( I think that's why I keep coming back & the 1 star is for the food) 0 stars for service! Zero friendliness ; zero personality ; zero everything from the hostess & waiters(ress)  Red robin needs to rethink the way their staff are to their customers

Worst service ever. Waited 40 minutes for 3 burgers that were nothing special. They claim to have endless fries but it took another 15 minutes of waiting until I just paid the bill and left. I would still probably be waiting on those "endless" fries

We have always liked the food here but this evening, the staff saved our night! After a rough day, our order was lost...oops, catastrophe, right? Well, the manager Mack took care of us. Sara, our bartender/waitress was great the whole way through. It was a great evening even though we had a significant wait....because the staff gave a darn. We will be back soon!

My 5 star review is TOTALLY BECAUSE OF MADDIE! She was such a GREAT server! Her customer device was AWSOM! I currently work in food service management so I know the value of customer service and she has it DOWN! She deserves recognition! Thank you MADDIE for a great experience!!!! O... And the burger and fries we delicious!

Went here with my wife and son on Friday and it was among the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant.  Burger was dry, fries cold, no condiments because they apparently ran out, and they even managed to have the beer lines in the bar mixed up such that the 805 and Sam Adams was mixed together.  Won't be going back
No excuse why service is slow when they are not busy. Save the trouble and go through a fast food joint to get better service

I ate at this restaurant over the weekend. I have eaten here many times before! I have many allergies, so ordered my chicken sandwich special, to accommodate my allergies. It came and was not prepared how I had asked. I could not eat it the way it was being served. We immediately told the server who was serving our meal. She took it back to the kitchen. Less then 2 minutes later it comes back. There is no way it could of been cooked again in that amount of time so we called over our waitress and told her what had happened. She immediately got the manager, who took my plate and apologized. About 5 to 10 minutes later my food was brought out just as I had ordered. I am VERY pleased with how all involved handled the situation! Thank you!!!

Terrible service. Very slow to get order taken. Then slow to get drinks. Slow to get food. Slow to refill drinks. I had to get up and grab my own napkins from waiter service station. I almost got up to refill my drinks from behind the counter drink unit before the waitress finally showed up again to ask if we needed a refill (clearly empty glasses were place at visible end of the table) and even then it took forever to get them.  I wouldn't care too much if the service was bad as long as the food made up for it, but the burgers was mediocre at best, not worth the money and definitely not worth the wait.

Meh. Not horrible but not really good either. I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ burger which was totally overpowered by the large amount of mayo on it, was barely warm, had a think slice of unmelted cheese on it, and for some strange reason they use shredded lettuce like you'd get on a taco for the burgers, what's up with that, how about nice fresh whole leaf.  I felt the portioning was ok but bordering on the small side and the wait staff was less than attentive as I was almost done eating before asked if I would like a refill on anything to which I responded yes I'd like another coke which took like ten minutes to come out during which time I had already finished eating. Would've been nice to have a drink while I was eating. They were not very busy either so I'm not sure about why the issues with quality and service.  The fries were really the only stand out of the visit. Really good.

I've been to the Red Robin several times since we live close by. I will never return again. Over the past several visits, the service as been atrocious. Recently my family went in and it took 1:45 to get our food. Four tables that were sat long after us got their food before we did. I flagged down the manager and complained and then never saw him again. Do yourself a favor and skip this place. The food is bad and the service is worse. We ended up getting our food to go because it was 9:00pm on a school night. I've never left a $0 tip before but I did that day. HORRIBLE!

This place is so it and miss, mostly miss! There is seriously only one waiter in the entire restaurant that is good and I wish I could remember his name. I took my three sons there on May 9 and regretted every minute of choosing red Robin for our dinner. The booth we sat in was filthy, there was food on the floors, there was french fries and all kinds of other debris in between the cushions from the bench that we were sitting on, I never got a drink refill that I asked twice for. He plain forgot one of my sons cheeseburger because he was too busy watching the basketball game that was on above us. My food was cold and they charged me three dollars to sing happy birthday to my youngest son and give him a bowl of melted ice cream with whip cream on top... The only way I will ever go to this location again is if I know the one good waiter is working if not I will turn around and walk out.  Use caution when choosing this location for a meal.
35 minutes for 4 burgers from the time we ordered until they showed up. Then on top of that 2 of the 4 were wrong. Can't get a simple cheeseburger with ices right. Will not come back. Ever.

A solid 4 stars for Red Robin! They have upped their game! When I used to go when I was younger the burgers were dry with no finesse. Now they're flavorful with a fair selection of burgers. I ordered the bacon bacon burger with bacon aioli. Really good and bacony!  The only thing I found to be a joke was that the waitress asked is how we wanted our burgers cooked. As expected, they came out overcooked but still edible. And what would you expect with a kitchen full of 20 somethings who aren't trained to cook burgers to a certain temp? It's a chain for crying out loud.

The food is good but I always have to remember to manage my expectations when coming here. My favorite thing on the planet is a good burger. But here they only cook them with "some pink or no pink" which I find incredibly annoying. Your name says gourmet burgers but you can't cook it to how the customer wants it. I always tell them "as much pink as you can get because it will go back" and even then it's nowhere near how I like my burgers. The selection of burgers are really good and appealing but it the burger it's self isn't right it's no good, at least to me anyway.

Besides the obvious horrible service...the bathrooms NEED to be addressed.  In the woman's bathroom there are 3 stalls, 1 of which is handicapped. The 2 non ADA stalls are non-usable!!!!  They are sooo small an average sized or long legged woman cannot use it.  The need to be reconfigured.  If you are fortunate enough to be able to use the bathroom, the paper towel and/or soap dispensers are never working!  I'm sorry, but these issues are a necessity and need to be addressed immediately.  I have come here often over the years and hoped that either mgmt and/or corporate would have corrected these issues, but apparently they wait for complaints.  Well,here you are!

Came here for lunch and the server took out order.  Our Oder came within 15 to 20 mins.  The reason why I have this restaurant two steps is that they got one of our orders wrong and our server didn't bother coming by to see if we needed more fries. We had to call out for one. Other than that food is good.

They have redeemed themselves. Almost. The food was much better than the last. But, DON'T TIP THE TAX. Some people might find this petty, but I find it rude and wrong. The Royal is one of the best burgers they have!  And how can you loose with the never ending fries. Again show a little etiquette and do not tip on the tax!

Compared to other red robins this red robin needs some major help. Wait is way to long for a burger. The quality of the food isn't there. The place was dirty and had plenty of staff just talking by the grill area. Won't be back . No one cares for the customer base at this red robin.

Why am I here again?  *sigh*  2.5 stars?  Seriously?  Supreme sacrifice for bottomless fries and strawberry lemonade.  I haven't been in since the remodel, and did it change ownership maybe?  *shrug* -1 star right off the bat - the "bathroom booth". I'll get to enjoy the fresh restroom aura, the banging doors, and the face of every person with diarrhea for the next hour. Thanks, RR.  Ok, they moved us, but now there's a screaming baby (I hate parents with no sense of public etiquette - take the screamer outside; restaurant, bring them some fries to chew for F-sake!). And there's only one busser working and four tables to be cleared.  No idea on food yet, I still stand by "this place sucks" if purely based on the experience.  Food - 45 minutes+ on delivery; fries: luke warm and 1 of 4 was wrong;; burgers:  2 of four burgers slightly pink and 1 of 4 was wrong.  Yeah, I stand by previous reviews... The Brentwood Red Robin is an around poor experience.

Last night stopped by this joint as its been a wile since we've been to Red Robbins and let me tell you ..... First off the service was mediocre at best , the staff is more like high school graduates having a good time.  The food was just throwin together with no pride on how it looked or tasted. "We we're not the only ones having issues with our food" , from the time we sat down there was people complaining about the same issues . We we're thinking they were picky people and we shouldn't have the same issues . I ordered the A-1 peppercorn burger with the works and got a bun,2pieces of red onion, a burnt patty with cold melted cheese , 1 slice smashed tomatoe , and a silver dollar size splash of A-1 sauce topped off with the bun . Wife's chicken sandwich was a fried patty sitting on top of pickles, shredded tomatoes,  and a pile of lettuce.  Not much quality control here if they keep this up I can't see the being open very much longer. Hope they get it together Red Robbins use to be a decent place to get a decent meal for the money .

We have been regular patrons of this location for a while.  Each time we go, we ask ourselves why.  The service is incredibly slow because the restaurant is NEVER adequately staffed.  The food is hit or miss.  Orders are often wrong.  The last time we went, we had to send our food back TWICE!  We spoke with the manager to relay our frustrations and he COMPLETELY AGREED with us!  He gave us our food was free, which is what it was worth.  We vowed that do to NEVER GO BACK!

If you feel like waiting 20 minutes for your drinks then this Red Robin is the place for you.  Staff is a 1 star and food is a 4 star, which is why we come once every couple of months crossing our fingers we get 1 or 2 of the half decent servers they have on staff.  At least they're newly renovated, so you have nice things to look while you wait hopelessly for a server to take your order.

I've given this place several tries and each time they've struck out. The service is horrible, you will wait at least 10minutes just to get greeted once seated. It seems they never have enough servers and food takes forever. The poor manager, nice white guy, is constantly taking over tables and comping checks. Today I had to send the hostess to hunt down the server after sitting 15min and nobody came over to even get our drinks. She seemed annoyed, didn't even apologize.  I would suggest they give larger portions of fries since you'll never see your server again for a "refill" of fries, drinks etc.
