Sad to say.. had a bad experience.. Went to this Red Robins location on Saturday night. I didn't get there until about 9:30p.m. or so. It was not busy at all.  Ordered some sodas and apps, then our main meals. Apps came out fast and were delicious as usual.  Food came. I wasn't too hungry so I just had some of my boyfriend's bottomless sweet potato fries. When we asked for the second batch they were ICE cold. Seemed like they were cooked and then placed in the fridge. I was super tired anyways, so I decided to have "one last fry" a call it a meal.. well that last fry was a huge mistake.. I almost CHOKED on the longest piece of hair. Ew. I was SO disgusted.  I get it, I used to wait tables, HAIR HAPPENS. It may not even be your hair.. and you have no control over it. What I didn't like is that when I kindly let the server know, she decided to speak to me like a baby and say "oh no, do you want me to get you some to-go" I felt mocked, and that it was VERY rude..  Because of how tired I was and with a long drive ahead of me, I said no thank you and the check would be fine.. I was in no mood to argue.  Sure enough, got the check, and nothing has been taken off or discounted. I thought that was really poor on the servers end.... If I were her, I  would of walked straight to management, let them know of the situation, and see what we could of done for the customers. I am not asking for a free meal, and while I understand they are bottomless fries, I was inconvenienced as a customer.  That's okay though, I discounted it myself by leaving her 15% instead of 20% tip.. If only she would of gone that extra step to make the customer feel valued, taken care of, and appreciated- she would of gotten 25-30% tip.  I was sick to my stomach the rest of the night. I will not be dining at this Red Robins again.

So I've been going to this red robin for the last six years. I haven't been there in a while. I first knot iced the new look. And ordered my favorites. French onion and a double cheese burger... need I say it cold crap. The waiting staff was over booked and the manager was 18. Then after taking back our food he made us pay for our drinks. I should have charged him for the hour it took to get my cold food. Bottom line .... never again. Sorry Red Robin.   You let children ruin your business bad bad bad

Could easily have been Five stars if only: 1. Our food hadn't been served cold after waiting too long for it and, 2. had our waiter checked back with us after taking our order and delivering our shakes and we were waiting and waiting and waiting and waiting for our hot food to arrive, and  3. If our waiter had checked the burger and fries to see if they were cold or hot (they were cold) when he finally delivered them to us. So it all came down to our waiter. He was nice, but we wanted nice And hot food. Twice a different waiter responded to our obvious looking around for help, and the manager brought us hot fries later on, after the rest of our meal was already finished. My husband will Never go back.

This place is crap. They spent a ton of money to revamp it and yet the service doesn't match up. They have a ton of open tables and yet they make people wait. Clearly they need to hire more wait staff. A lot of the food is subpar.  Their burgers are good but that's about it.

I have no problems coming here.  My latest visit I ordered something new.  I tried the Black & Bleu Burger fully cooked (they'll ask if u want it medium rare or fully cooked).  I was a little worried that they might overcook it but the meat was cooked PERFECT. Juicy, tender & full of deliciousness.  Will definitely go back to try some of their other new burgers.

This to Red Robin: Do something about your awful service and please, do read the other reviews. I came here today and ordered a hamburger and an appetizer. I just got the appetizer and waited at least 40 minutes for the food. The waiter never came back and when I asked a waitress for my food, she sent somebody with some french fries to munch on, saying "food will be here in two minutes, we apologize". After 7 minutes of munching french fries and other other people who arrived later than me getting their food instead of me, I just got up, left a $10 bill for the appetizer and left to go somewhere else. I have NEVER BEEN TREATED LIKE THIS IN A RESTAURANT. Read the reviews for today May 15 and you'll see I'm not the only one. Red Robin restaurants are OK elsewhere, not here.

Really hit or miss. And mostly miss, recently.  Went out with the family and asked my waitress if the veggie burger was made with whole beans. She told me it wasn't beans, but I could ask for it meatless? I was really confused, and she clearly was too.  Food took way too long to be served. When the waitress brought it out, she toppled the burger off of the plate onto the table and didn't offer to bring a new one.

We came the other night and it was a Friday night of course it was busy the waiter rushed us to order so we ended up only ordering my daughter her food first . I asked for a Dr Pepper and a water with lemon I never got my water . My boyfriend ordered onion rings besides fries and they were so cold like they came out of the fridge . I got a burger with fries . I only received 8 French frys as a side . Really their portions are so skimpy but their prices are high I probably won't be returning unfortunately
The hostess were nice and sat us right away. But that's about the only good thing that happened. We had no server for the first 15 minutes. I had to ask for a server to come to the table.

1 star for the gourmet cheeseburger and bottomless fries 1 star for the hostess  My waiter took FOREVER to come take my order. The restaurant wasn't crowded at all but my order took a while to come out. I think the waiter forgot to put it in. He dropped off the food and disappeared! Hostess brought me more fries. Manager said the waiter went on break. They suck!

My burger was not that great, a little over cooked and dry. Our server had zero personality.  She literally threw our silverware on the table. For some reason she refused to reach over my husband to place my food and drink in front of me. This server decided it was okay to place all our food in front of my husband and let him sort it out. It also took forever for our food to come from the kitchen.  How long does it take to cook three burgers?  Too long for us!  Think I'll write this place off my list of preferred restaurants.  To sum up - poor service and mediocre food.

Before I begin, let me just say I walked away from this "restaurant" this afternoon with not only a stomach ache, but a valuable life lesson. Possibly the same sort of lesson Rihanna learned after Chris brown whooped her a**.  People don't often really change. I can not tell you how many chances I have given this Red Robin location . Every single burger i have ordered here in the past few months has been luke-warm, as well as their "bottomless" fries. Sorry Red Rocket, but as long as you keep pumping out those mediocre frozen french fries, there's no need for that lack of a bottom. Oh and don't even get me started on the fact that they started charging for the dipping sauces they offer for the fries there....the one god damn thing that kept bringing  me back is now up-charged. What a crock. What, are they going to start for ketchup next week? Anyways, I go there for lunch today and order the crispy chicken sandwich thinking I'd switch it up and maybe they wouldn't suck so much at their jobs for once. WRONG.  it wasn't that the food tasted necessarily bad right then and there...it was what came after..... Thank god I live 3 minutes up the road off Minnesota because holy SH*t .....literally. I have been in and out of my bathroom since I got home this afternoon. And when I'm not sitting on the toilet I'm sitting on an ice cube. Not sure what exactly went wrong but i can't say it would be the first time the brothers from down south of the border that Red Robin keeps in back failed to cook my food properly.  Let me just say there is no way in hell I will be returning to this location. I don't even have the energy to lay into the servers in this post (I feel another trip to the bathroom coming on very soon ladies and gentlemen)..but to keep it short they SUCK!!! Finding my waitress is almost as difficult as finding a new mommy for my squirrel brained children. My advice to the lovely Red Robin Corporation....fire every last scum bag working at this joint and start fresh . I'd compare this shanty to the Titanic when it was 92% submerged under water..but unlike the Titianic, theres no life rafts to save this sh*thole.

Recently I decided to go give this Red Robins another chance. Since Red Robins has been my favorite place to get a delicious chicken sandwich. As soon as I arrived we were seated right away and the kind young lady asked us what we'd like to order right away. I ordered the Burnin Love and substituted the beef for chicken. I was with 2 other people who had ordered burgers. The food was ready to eat within 15-20 minutes and it was so delicious. The person who helped us this time was Jenni she was very hard working, quick, and friendly providing excellent service!  Thank You So Much For Reading My Recent Review and Fixing The Past Issues This Red Robin Was Facing, I still have not received any calls from the company as of yet!

I'm a big fan of Red Robin, and this was probably the worst one I've been to. There's many things about this place that were off when I came here. First we waited for 20+ minutes to be seated although there were open tables. When we got seated it was obvious why there's a wait; the middle section was served by only one server.  It took 10 minutes to ask us what drinks we wanted, then an additional 30+ minutes for the food.  Apparently they have two separate kitchens in terms of dividing the items like salad and burgers. While our burgers were ready, getting cold, they had to still make the salad. The men's bathroom was disgusting, the urinal didn't flush so I used the stall (which I recommend you using the furthest from the door because it has more room). The food was fair; the fries were sometimes cold and fresh. The server (Maddy) was nice though, she brought us fries while we were waiting, checked up on us frequently and always had a smile. Overall would not recommend this location of Red Robin; very disappointed.
I ordered garlic fries and received powder fry. Eew. Cold slaw was warm. Mothers day bummer. Bjs next year.

Love the new remodel to the dinning area. Always a great place to eat for our lunch break. Staff are attentive and on there game! Burgers are amazing here! And don't forget the freckled lemonade with unlimited frys

Decided to finally go out for dinner with my children and never again go here...15 minutes after being seated and still no waiter, I had to flag down someone for drinks. Then another 20 minutes after drinks arrived, I had to flag down a different waiter to take our order cause we still had NO waiter. Food was good but would have been better if they had better CUSTOMER SERVICE...LEFT VERY UPSET cause we spent just under 2hrs and more then 75% of the time we spent waiting for service/food/drinks.

Owner sent us a gift card to try them again.  So I took my daughter there yesterday.  I have to say the service was stellar.  Twice a manager came by and asked if we needed anything.   Our food came out fast & hot.    The restaurant was very clean.  We'll be back.  Thank you to the ownership for making the corrections! We'll be back!!!

Came in to eat a nice f'n burger and got a cold burger with a side of cold fries. I got the botemless sweet fries and when i ask for more i get back the steak fries. It sounds like the cooks are having a blast man. I hope these orders dont interrupt their fun.

I've always liked Red Robin but the last time we went, it was horrible. The order took forever to come out. Fries were cold, smoothie was more like chunks of ice, 2 plates came w/garlic bread & we didn't get that. The waiter said they ran out of bread but didn't bother to tell us until we brought it up to him. It was just all a bad experience.
Waitress was good.   Food arrived after a long wait.  Hamburger, fries, and tea were not very warm.  This is my second visit to this Red Robin.  It is likely my last.
I called for take out. The chick said 25 minutes and we waited an hour. Then getting the food our burgers & fries were soggy. Never again with this, should've went to McDonalds.

Red Robin, you know what you get.  Wasn't busy, had an appetizer: mini pretzels with cheese. Cheese was just terrible. I could feel my arteries clogging. The burger was ok, not a lot of fries. Bartender was ok, they were not busy. I ate, I left.
A+ Service, food, and drinks. The hostest Katrina was fantastic, got us seated in 5 minutes max. All in all it was honestly amazing.

The past 3 times we have been there we get seated and never get service again. This time we actually left because after 15 mins of people walking by and not acknowledging us (the place was not busy) we knew how this visit would play out. Sucks because we really wanted them to be better this time.

I have had the worst luck at this location. The food is always bad and this last time was no different. We waited for an hour to get our food and the burgers were so well done they were crispy. When we told the waitress she said we had only been there 20 min which wasn't even half of the problem

I would not recommend this location if you want a Red Robin experience. First, the service is slow. Had to wait 30mins for the food.  Second, the burger I ordered was really dry and overcooked. The fries were saggy. I got a stomach ache and had to go to the bathroom after I ate here.  I am a Red Robin fanatic and the best location nearby is the one in Concord. They serve quality food there and have a better service.

So after waiting 40 freaken minutes, our order finally came super cold and dry. I am no longer hungry. I think the server forgot to put in our order because the family next to us got their order in pretty quick and they came in about 20 minutes after us! WTF!

Brought the family here for my sons birthday. Seated quickly and waitress brought drinks and took our order shortly thereafter. And thaaaats when it went downhill.  I dont have unrealistic expectations that the food ordered will resemble the picture on the menu. That said, all of our burgers were over cooked. Black, dry and tastless. My wifes burger had two small pieces of bratwurst which were also burnt and dry. Her sweet potato fries were cold. Not "taken from the fryer and left on the counter" kind of cold. But literally still cold in the center from the freezer. Our waitress never came by to see if we needed anything. It wasnt until we summoned her from the little electronic gadget on the table that she came. "More fries?" No thanks, still defrosting the ones you brought us earlier.  We decided to push our luck with dessert. Had to order from the little electronic gadget again. Went for the cheesecake. When the waitress brought it to us, we requested more napkins. As I cut into the cheesecake, I realized it was still frozen. We all ate our frozen cheescakes. Never did get those napkins.  Had to pay using that electronic gadget. First time, it said it was unable to process. Started over and was successfull the second time. When i got home, I found out that the payment went through twice. Bottom line, if you want burnt/dry burgers, cold food that should be warm/hot, frozen dessert that should be thawed, and non personal service, then this Red Robin is for you. And wheres my napkins?

I have eaten at this location at least three times in the last six months and the previous two occasions were at least normal. Today was beyond sub par. We were seated quickly and within five minutes our server stopped by and made her introduction and took our drink order as well as our kids meal order. Drinks arrived in a fair amount of time (15-20 minutes) and not long after our kids meals arrived. The kids both ordered Mac and cheese. Their meals arrived cold and extremely watery. Neither kid really complained because they were hungry but both my wife and I noticed. Our meals arrived some twenty minutes later. No real complaints about our meals, they tasted the way burgers should taste. The complaints are more about the service.  Our server was horrible. She had three tables to wait on and somehow couldn't manage any of them. She would attend to one and ignore the others, never bothering to ask if the other tables needed anything as she walked past. Twice we requested another set of silverware and extra napkins.  Overall it was just not up to our expectations, and as a regular diner at Red Robin our expectations are not very high. We go there because the kids like it but we won't be going back. I do not recommend anyone else going there either.

This is one of the best Red Robins I have been too! I was seated right away, waitress was quickly over to take our beverage orders & to answer any questions. Once we ordered waitress brought us a order of their famous fries to enjoy while we waited. I had the DGB burger, A+. Cooked as i requested, my wife had a bacon cheeseburger also made how she likes it. Waitress continued to check on us, even bringing additional orders of fries & ranch which we didn't have to ask for. All in all a great experience. Will definitely be back.
Hairiest place on earth. Staff is unsanitary and obviously hairy based on howmuch hair we found in our food. Yuck! Ruined it for me. Concord is better.

I remember long ago when Red Robin was really good food.  I was rather disappointed with dried out chicken and watered down drinks the last couple times.  The quality has really gone down hill in recent years.  :(

My only problem with this location is how slow service if. Not the taking of orders. But getting it too the table. It's very slow. I've been here twice where my order got listed. And bottomless fries is a joke. It takes so long too get that second order you might as well forget it.  I love the bar here the bartenders are friendly and talkative but the kitchen staff sucks.

I went here with my friend that I was visiting in Brentwood. I ordered the peppercorn burger and it was delicious, although I could not detect the pepper flavor. The only thing that I thought was sub par was the bacon that came on it was half cooked and greasy. Fortunately, our waitress was on the ball and checked right back with us after our food was delivered. She brought me new bacon that was cooked more and somewhat less greasy, but I put it in a napkin to absorb the rest of the grease. Then I just took all the bacon including the original two strips and took it home for breakfast the next morning.  I did go in to the ladies restroom to wash my hands before eating and I found it to be clean and stocked up with the appropriate paper products. Oh, and since I signed up on their website, my burger was free during my birthday month! Thanks, Red Robin!

My friends and I haven't been here for awhile so we decided to come here for dinner. The hostess was very polite and we were seated right away. Our server was a male, and he came about 15 minutes after we were seated; therefore, we were already ready to order our food. He separated our orders into 3 tabs because we were paying separately. We were never given any silverware the entire time we had our food; luckily, we ordered food that didn't needed any silverware (except a friend of mine had coleslaw with her entreé). By the time he came back to ask how everything was going (which was about 20 minutes later), it was too late to ask for silverware since we were halfway done with our food. I felt like he was rushing us because he gave our checks way too early. He also messed up on one of our checks; my drinks were added to one of my friends tab. The service could've been better but at least the food was great. I'll probably give this place another chance, but hopefully I'll have a better server then.

I substituted broccoli for fries and it was served stone cold.  The meal took for ever.  The server seemed to have disappear (maybe went in break?).  I had nothing to drink for 15 minutes.  I also waited for ever for a second order of broccoli which I now think she forgot.  Another server brought me more within 5 minutes of flagging her down. This was my third time here with my wife and my little girl. All three times, we had to wait 12-15min for our food. The last two times we came, our food was cold. This was our first visit to Red Robin. We wanted to have a good burger so thought we would give it a try since we had just been to the Movies. I walk in two girl in front just ignore me for like 10 mins. They just stand there talking to each other about therr out side life.I just said ho in order for one of them to speak to me and seat my family, girl name was katrina very rude.

DO not expect to get waited on in a timely manner  Went once waited over 10 after being seated to at least be acknowledged - finally found the manager and got a wait person to take our drink order. I went here for lunch today and ordered a burger well. After waiting almost a hour to get our order we get cold bread a raw burger and 2 raw kids pizzas. Jeff .C you are a terrible waiter i know that you have work here for a long time but the thing about a job is  you are supposed to get better but you my friend have not after my experience the other day and reading all the Yelp reviews management must not have high expectations I am all for hiring old people but you might have to go if you cant even handle a party of 7 two of which are kids

Would give a zero if possible. Been here three times, once by myself. Walked in and stood at front for 3-4 minutes, and was never greeted. Sat at bar, service was OK. Bartender chatted with a friend the whole time, and also gossiped loudly with every co-worker who came by. Burger was good, but not worth $13. Fries portion was tiny and free refill took a long time. Went with hubby and the boys for lunch today.   Dylan had a cheeseburger with a chocolate milkshake.  Parker had Mac and cheese and a milkshake.   Hubby had the mushroom burger and I had the burning love (jalapeño).   Everyone enjoyed their lunch.  I was a little loud but it was okay because we weren't worried about our kids being loud.   We'll totally go back.

Good place to take the kids so we eat here now and again.  Service varies, of course, but has generally been good.  With the other restaurants opening almost next door, BJ's and Black Angus, this store is a little less busy than before.  Different price point to some degree of course. The menu has changed a bit here and there but has enough variety for the kids and adult try to stay to the lower cal side.  Food is generally good and any issues we've had have been taken care of in short order. Going back tomorrow with Grandma and Grandpa visiting.

Horrible service! Waited at our table for almost an hour just to get our water! In total we probably spent over 3hrs there! We never got our appetizer, the drinks kept coming back wrong, some of the food was cold, I felt so bad for waiter because she was doing all she can, it looked like she was the only one working there at the time, everyone around us were just getting up and leaving because the service was terrible, a lot of people were just leaving without paying because it probably would have taken them another hour to try and get some one to take them their tab, I was ready to do the same but I felt really bad for our server so I stayed, the next day we called back and spoke to the manger and got a gift card

Red Robin Brentwood has had their ups and downs since opening, and they are in the down cycle  now.  They changed the decor and separated the place into three 'rooms' and fancied up the decorations so it looks nice when you go in. And that's where the up cycle ends.  They are now using some new automation card reader and menu /order tablet on the tables, but no one told us about them or how to use them.  Surprise!  if you use the thing to play games, while waiting forever to see your food to show up, you pay $1.99 Entertainment Fee.   They seem to be under staffed, and the management team doesn't really care about customer experience. Perhaps that's a feature of transitioning to the new table top tablets, because although there was a nice waitress to take our order and bring us our food, the kitchen must have only one cook, it took 45+ minutes to get our food; and there must be only one bus kid, because there were  dirty tables in a half empty room for the whole time we sat there - well over an hour.   The endless fries never did show up.  I'd wait on this place until you start seeing more than 3 stars in the yelp reviews.

As much as people rave about this place, I just can't quite grasp why. I've been to various locations, but the burgers are mediocre at best. The bottomless fries taste like they've been sitting under the lamps. If you're hungry, it'll do. You're better off going to In n Out Burger.

I've eaten here a total of 3 times. My first experience was great. However my last two were absolutely ridiculous. The service was slow and the server wouldn't refill my drink. One time. Literally one time my drink was refilled. My friend who sat with me had her drink refilled many times but for some reason the server never even bothered to fill mine up. There was also a hair in my cheese when I requested it to be on the side. This was my 2nd experience.  Then on my last and most recent experience. Not only was the service slow but my food was gross and dry! The server was kind and I did appreciate that however it took a while for him to bring our drinks. When the food finally came I was missing a topping. I only requested 2 toppings on my burger and they forgot the tomatoes! Not only that but the buns on my burger tasted and felt as if they had been out in the air and hardened and dried out and on top of it they "toasted" the buns as if to try to hide that they were hard and they burnt them. Absolutely horrible. I couldn't even finish my food! The fries are normally good but this time around they tasted as if they were not fresh and just reheated or just undercooked. I will not be returning here.  They need to get their cooking right and service!

There was so many people complaining to the manager by the time we left it was ridiculous!
The food is good, but the service here, is horrible.  We joke when we do go, how long we will have to wait for service and food.  We keep trying once a year, but no luck at getting better service.

First time I have ever been I went with my friend and it was great the waitress was extremely nice food was incredible just how I had wanted it it was really good, second time I went I went with my boyfriend and the waitress was nice I guess ( she definitely needed more training)it took about 25 minute's for us to get our food the waitress never came to check on us when we were waiting for the food finally got her attention she didn't come over to the table she just kinda yelled that it was coming not really loud yelling but she could have just walked up to our table pretty much the only time she came by was to take our order to get us refills (after we got her attention) and to give us our food and then when she gave us our check (and they weren't even busy) so my review on this place is spotty some times great some time's you might just want to go elsewhere overall goodluck depending on when you go

Why can't Red Robin get their act together?  We've given up on the Tracy site so headed to Brentwood hoping to get the food and service we used to be accustomed to at other locations.  Unfortunately what we got was another bad experience.  My husband loves their fish and chips so we were really disappointed when, after waiting an hour for our food, they served me a completely different burger than what I had ordered and my husband's and daughter's orders were cold.  Ugh, something really needs to change with the management of these restaurants if they're to survive.

Even though my meeting stood me up, the servers were kind to check on me often and make sure I was not neglected. Friendly servers, helpful bartenders, great food! Love the burgers, tortilla soup, and the fries are fantastic!

Felt like a yummy burger and fries for lunch, took my 2 co-workers with me, one of which has never been to a Red Robin. We only had an hour so we let the hostess know we would need to be out quick. Our server just said to leave and not to worry about paying for our soft drinks. Wasn't really apologetic at all. They really need to get their stuff together!

Had another bad visit. Ordered food took over 40 min to get and then food was horrible. Cold fries. Then the manager comes over and said it had been made wrong so they had remade it but nobody could come out and tell us that's what was taking so long. My wife didn't because st didn't want to wait again  Bill the manager didn't charge us for this experience and told him we would never be back. The waiter told us after that the can't keep cooks and the service sucks , pretty bad when you're own staff tells you that

The food was typical of what you would expect from a Red Robin. Nothing out of this world, but a decent place to have a good beer and take advantage of their bottomless fries. Horrible horrible service! The food was fantastic but we got all at different times, 2 burgers were wrong asked for ranch 3 times got so tired of waiting for refills we walked up to get them done. So many mistakes left hungry and no attempt to fix anything.

Wow I saw this place had remodeled and thought we would give it a try again. Big mistake. It took 30 minutes to get our drinks and 50 minutes to get our food. I'm spreading my red robin royalty card and never coming back.

My husband went to pick up something to go tonight (Wednesday).  It was a long wait for he and my daughter. I asked for the Avo-Cobb-O salad that was on the online menu, but what I got was missing the avocado, hard boiled egg and blue cheese that was supposed to be on it. It did have cucumber which wasn't in the description. Very disappointed, but my husband loved his burger.

Absolutely nothing wrong with this Red Robin. Clean, friendly, fast service. Although, my husband and I went on a Tuesday afternoon, so of course there were no customers.  The food was DELICIOUS (we both ordered the Banzi burger.) I had a Shirley Temple to drink and it was really fresh and delicious. Our waitress was friendly and kept our drinks filled the whole time. Whenever I'm in the Bay again, I will most likely stop by this Red Robin again. :-)

It was aiight. I mean it was good or bad it was just ehhhh lol totally not what I expected but the food was ok. It could have been better but the bottomless fries took forever. I ran out and I had to wait almost 30 minutes. After that I just lost my appetite.

Horrible and slow service. We have tried a few times giving it another shot, but we almost left both times. They seem to always be short staffed and the food is just okay. Its also way over priced. We will never go back unless we see new ownership or management.

Service is good when you get there on a good day & there are enough servers, super long waits on days when they're short-staffed (which is more often than it should be).   The food itself is okay - it's a burger joint, not a high-end steakhouse - but if you're looking forward to those "bottomless fries" they like to advertise, you're in for a long wait between servings.

The food was meh. It was quieter than other Red Robin's I've been to. The staff was a mix of completely disinterested (front of the house/check in girl), to new and training (ok), to great waiter (fast). However, this place is DIRTY! Everything I touched was sticky. As I felt I had to wash my hands a lot, I went into the bathroom. OMG! What a mistake! Filthy! Don't try to actually use the bathroom. One was broken. One toilet was so close to the door as you shut it, it was claustrophobic. I felt like having a tetanus shot, lots of hand sanitizer and a shower after we left. Never going back.

Monday night,  a little slow, so service should be okay.  Nope. I usually don't slam a place, or have to.  But Red Robin is a total rip. The same story my last 4 visits, to 3 RRs. Won't be back.  To any.

I would give this place a 0 if I could. I'm still sitting here waiting on my nachos from over an hour ago. i came for lunch here it was good but the service was awful last time i was there it took us 20 minutes to get a table we went to fatburger but the drinks were fast the burgers damn so good

If I could give zero stars I would. There is absolutely NO service here. EVERYTHING is cold when it should be hot. I am never asked for refills on fries and they always make it seem like a chore to take our orders or to fix an order. Eerg.
It was okay. Not very memorable. Every single time we have gone, the same bland experience.  3 stars for being mediocre.
The food was great but service was slow. There was only one waitress on our whole side so I don't blame her. Overall really good

My kids love this place. Wife and me not so much. Super slow. Don't be in a hurry. Expect food to be wrong. Really, every time something is wrong/cold. Service is not bad but inexperienced. Would it hurt to look up when you walk through the room. I know you are delivering something but it would be nice for you to at least catch my eye and give me the "one second" look. New table top video/cashiers are super annoying. Charge $2 to play video games, yeah thanks for leaving that on the table for my kids to see. Its just an up-sell tool to make you spend more money, plus it means the waiters pay less attention to you. To top it off it auto put the tip at 20%! Really? If I wanted to spend lots of money for dinner I would not be at Red Robin's. Only give 2 stars because my kids like it and most likely will be back (kicking and screaming).

For starters let me say that Red Robin is normally one of my family's favorite places to get burgers yet today's experience left something to be desired.  The restaurant was not busy when we arrived yet we were sat at a dirty table that was barely bussed.  It still had 2 dirty booster seats at the table, one of which was laying under the table on its side. Furthermore, whoever was working in the kitchen and made my food completely messed up my order.  I ordered the fiery ghost tavern style tavern double, which is my favorite,  but the only thing that was on my burger when it arrived was the fresh jalapeños.  The fried jalapeños, tomato, and lettuce were missing from my burger. I had to ask our waiter about the missing items. He went to the kitchen and came back with the fried jalapeños.  Also there were less then 8 of the steak fries in the basket with my burger. Needless to say I was not amused with my favorite burger being below the normal level I am used to.  On a positive note, our waiter Jonny was beyond amazing. He was very attentive and helpful the entire time we were there.  He is definitely a waiter that we hope to have again in the future.

Somewhere along the long and winding path of cultivating my own contentment, I learned to savor the small things.  Life will deal you tough hands. Whether you are riding high or hanging low, as long as you don't close your eyes to them - simple delights are abundant. For me, freckled lemonade is one of those things. A grown adult stuffed into a Red Robin costume, complete with screaming red tights doesn't hurt either. I love the layout of this location. It's open, airy and bright.  Ask me why there is a working television in the floor, at the entrance. I'll tell you I don't know.  The service was great. The fiesta salad was delicious as always, as was the bleu ribbon burger and steak fries.  Welcome to Brentwood Red!  My family and I are so glad that you are here.

Food was good...everyone in our party had a burger.  Our mixed drinks were a bit on the weak side, but the BEST thing?  They have gluten-free hamburger buns!!  Being gluten-free, it's rare that I get to enjoy a burger at most chain restaurants.   Our service was good, and it was a busy Friday night.  Our waiter kept our water full and was entertaining.

I just left this Red Robin store highly disappointed.  We came in after watching a movie at the AMC and it was around 4:30pm.  We were seated and the dining room had around 7 tables occupied on our side of the restaurant.  After 10 minutes of sitting there unnoticed we got up and left.  The server came out a few times to other tables and gave them food and drink, but still no acknowledgement we were there.  As we passed the hostess station she was having a conversation with another employee.  I interrupted her and told her what had happened.  She apologized, but I was already halfway out the door.  This is not the first time I've experienced unacceptable service from this location.  I will never go back!

My daughters and I went there one evening and it took literally 25 min for someone to acknowledge we were even there to get a menu. Then the food took forever to come out and the management did nothing. I will never go to this Red Robin in again I have true several times to give them a chance. But each time service is bad and floors are gross. Sticky,slimy floors.  This place need help.

The host (punk teenage brat) obviously could care less about his job, it was obvious we inconvenienced his texting to seat us and get us a highchair.  Took for ever to get drinks. No one brought any silverware, had to ask when our meal arrived.  Waitress was attentive, but was obviously inexperienced and kept forgetting things.  I asked for no pink in the burger and it came out pink. My wife asked for a refill on fry's and never got them.  Most likely won't be back.

It pains me to write this because I have always loved Red Robin (been to several locations) but this was not a good experience and I won't be back to this location for a long time. I sat at the bar (usually the best service is there) and this bartender was totally overwhelmed making kid drinks like shakes and Shirley temples. That way they never have to make a connection with their customers and never ask if the experience was enjoyable.

I would give then 0 stars if it was an option. We walked in at 9:05 pm and the restaurant was a ghost town. I dont like how they come out with the straws in the drink we don't know if there hands are washed or if it is a new straw i think they should let us put the straws in our drinks not them

Horrible service. We waited over 20 minutes to receive our drinks. Rather than redecorate the restaurant, they need to retrain their staff. Our appetizers and entrées came out at the same time. Came here this evening. Two adults two children. 5 empty tables but Manager instructed host to not seat anyone because the waitress/waiter was "backed up". Always an excuse for things that should be easy to fix. Red Robin is NOT what it used to be. Just reminds me why I HATE chain restaurants.

We recently moved to the area and our kids wanted to eat at their favorite place. Sadly the burgers were burned. I didn't want to completely give up on red robin so we tried it again a few weeks later and the burgers were burned again. Sorry red robin but we will not be coming back.

So I told my dad here for his birthday today with my family and my sisters family in total we had 6 adults and 4 kids. We knew what we wanted and ordered it but it took 20 minutes for our drinks and almost an hour for out food. We got out food and mine and my sisters food was cold. We told the manager but nothing happened. For the terrible service and good we felt it wasn't ok to leave a tip for our waitress it just didn't feel right i know that's how they make money but it just wasn't ok today plus they spilled my husbands drink on him and my daughter.
everytime iv been here iv gotten extremely  sick, and the staff is always fighting ,one guy was telling his boss off,  the food sat and was cold , don't waste your money

Red Robin makes good food but this Red Robin has the worst service. People are cramped in at dinner time and have to wait so long for their food. The best suggestion I can give is do not come at dinner time.

Here with my husband and son tonight; cannot even believe the service. We have been here 40 mns and have not even received our appetizer. Drinks came after 25 mns. It is so unbelievably cold in here!! Us and three other tables have asked for the air to be turned down. My husband literally had to stand on a chair to turn off the fan above us, after we asked TWICE it to be turned off for us and no one did. We have even asked to speak to a manager TWICE and were told the manager would not come speak to us because he is "busy"!  WOW!

Unlimited fries is 70% the reason why I come here. You've got to keep asking for them though as soon as your new batch comes though.  The burgers are good, nothing to go crazy over.  Service is a bit slow but they're usually pretty busy.  +  their Beer Shakes are hella good! (Don't knock it till you try it) !

I have had the opportunity to experience several Red Robin locations, including this one a few times before. I have consistently had poor experiences with customer service at this location specifically in the past, however I returned recently because Red Robin does make a good burger, and as they are his favorite meal these days, we as a family wanted to get my grandfather a burger on his birthday.  We should have driven to Concord for it.  Immediately upon entering the restaurant I was greeted with the substandard customer service experience I have become used to at this location.  When I asked for a booth instead of a table the hostess stated that it was not possible to place a high chair at the end of the booth because it was a fire hazard. Even after explaining it was done there many times in the past, she not only refused to do it but was extremely rude about it. How this is a fire safety hazard when it does not reduce the wide walk way much at all is beyond me, however being polite I'm certain is not a safety hazard. Nor is refraining from walking by the table glaring at us.  The food was overall good with a few exceptions: 1) One meal not made as ordered. 2) Sweet potato fries delivered cold to adult customer even after having to wait extended time after other food for them to be available; yet were given to children so hot they had to let them cool a little before eating them. Overall, another poor experience at this location.  Sad, because as a company I have usually really enjoyed Red Robin.

Absolutely the worst dining experience I've had in a very long time. We waited about 30 minutes for a table, although we saw a few empty ones not being used. When we did get seated, we were taken to the room on the right and had to side shuffle and try very hard to not bump anyone as we maneuvered to our table. The tables were so close to each other that the waiters and anyone walking by had to shimmy to get by and we had crotches and buttocks in our faces the entire meal. This is very unsafe how the room was set up. It had 5 huge tables where there should have been 3. The waitress even said it's very hard to move around in this place. I'm worried for the safety of the staff and people who dine here, this could potentially be a terrible situation if there was a need to get out quickly. Our food was not that great either, we will not be going back to this restaurant. We will drive to concord if we feel like going to another Red Robin, although, after last night ... I don't think I will ever go back.

Went for lunch yesterday. We were the only ones in the restaurant it was still pretty early, ordered our food took 30 minutes to come out.  You would expect hot food if you waited that long right? Well... NO not here.  I like many others have given this place several chances and to be honest it is hit and miss but I do think this was the last. So our burgers showed up way way over cooked and as the other reviews have said Luke warm at best.  My friend and I went because we were craving burgers, but neither were satisfied.  I would have sent it back had we not already waited 30 minutes and my kids were with us there is no way another 30 minutes would have worked out.  Service is was slow as always and it is like where's Waldo when trying to find the waiter or waitress  to get your bill.  Sorry Red Robin last chance I'll go to Lumpy's when I want a burger

The service here has progressively gotten worse. I was a little skeptical coming in again to get a bite to eat before our movie. We gave ourselves 1h and 10 minutes to seat down, order and eat. Our meal arrived 45 minutes later we ordered, giving us 10 minutes to eat. Like last time, the waitress brought items that we didn't order and forgot items that we did order. This was our last time here.

We arrived around 4pm today and we ordered  at 4:15pm. We were still waiting for our food at 4:59pm. We opted to leave because the service was that bad.  Do not go to this restaurant. Other people were served before us. People that came in 15 and 30 minutes after us came in and we're served. This ruined my daughters birthday, because we were big fans of this chain until we had the poor service today. Do not go to this restaurant  because  the service was very poor.

Horrible!! Never again will we go here. After about an hour with no food we finally just told the server to package our food up to go. She came back and told us she forgot to put our food in and there was one ticket ahead of us. Thirty minutes later she finally gave us our food to go. We got home and my sons oranges weren't in the bag. It was the worst service I've ever had. We won't be going back there.

Worst service ever. Last night we went there to eat. It took us 20 mins to be seated then another 20 for a waiter to even come up to us. Then we waited 15 mins for our drinks my husband waited an aditional 20 for his beer. We waited 45 mins just for them to bring out my daughter's meal then another 20 for me and my husband's. When the food came out both of our burgers were wrong and the fries were cold which didn't make sense. We waited so long for the food to be brought out cold and wrong. So we asked to speak to a manager because we no longer wanted the food and wanted it removed from the bill. We explained everything to the manager and all he could say is I'm speachless. Then said if your willing to wait a little longer we will re make your burger and fries and we said no we just want to pay and leave. It then took an additional 20 mins just for them to get the bill right. The family at the table next to us said they were having the same problem and the restaurant was not even busy. We will not be returning to this one ever again.

This place was horrible I went with my fiancé and they messed up my order and gave me the wrong burger. No big deal until they give me my burgers wrong again and when I finally got my burger in the first bite there was a bug!! Went again a month later and ended up with pubes in my food so never again will I go again

The service we revived to day was so poor. We had David as a waiter. I think he expected us to order our food when we ordered our drinks, but we weren't ready. So we said come back with our drinks then we will order. After that he ignored us for twenty minutes. Then came back and asked us for the orders. We never got a refill, he never said how are you doing. Then the others guy came with our food that was cold. David didn't bring any silverware to eat with. We had to ask for it he forgot our dipping sauce. It was just bad all around service. My tip to you be ready to order when you are seated. And maybe you won't experience what we did.

I used to work here, and I can attest that the staff here works very hard every night. Every server knows what they're doing, and tries their hardest to give everyone the best experience. A lot of the ill-reviews here seem to be from out-of-ordinary experiences, as I know that management is always on site in case of issues. I suggest coming here on weeknights, because the weekends get packed and crazy! As for the establishment itself, it's like every other Red Robin! Great food, affordable price, and a great family atmosphere. The decorations are cool to look around at, and their menu is dynamic and breathing and changes every few months. I highly suggest getting bottomless freckled lemonade! And fries are bottomless too, so make sure to order those with whatever you decide on. The Royal Red Robin Burger offers a fried egg on it.. and it's delicious! If you're into sports, they always have big games on! And they have a full bar. If you are looking for quick seating, say that you want to sit in the bar. You'll get better service there and seated quickly in the high-tops!

A member of my group had serious food allergies. Their response was to direct me to their website, which  is really disturbing. Either their food is so processed they can't tell what's in it anymore,  or their staff is unable to read ingredient labels.

I have not been to one of these joints in years. I pretty much have most of my memories as a kid at these places, indulging in the mile high mud pie along with mediocre burgers and fries (which to me at the tender age) probably tasted amazing......Times have changed and so have my taste buds. My friend and I had a craving for a burger and being this was close by and I had not been to them in years, I decided to give them a shot. The place is your typical chain diner style restaurant, appearing slightly unkept this time. I ordered the patty melt with onion rings on the side and my friend ordered the turkey burger. Our waitress was extremely upbeat and friendly and incredibly helpful so that was an absolute plus. My burger was a slight disapointment.Taste wise it was ok, portion size of the patty was weak, small and just a few steps down from what a diner style burger should be. Onions ring were typical decent. My friend was in spurge mode and wanted to order that mile high pie....( yes disastrous) and I have to say, I had several bites and that baby was as good as I remember, unfortunately being I am a little older with a slightly slower metabolism, the few bites had to end quickly. Overall, service was sincere and on top, food was mediocre though, I would probably give them another shot if close by.

Don't come on a Wednesday afternoon! Only 1 server and the manager. Only about 7 total tables.. We were her for about 2 hours total. Had extra servers just chillin and eating. Make them clock on and help if you can't handle it. It's that simple!! Love the food but hate the service!

It's funny how Red Robin has always been my favorite restaurant, and now it is my daughter's favorite too. The Classic Cheeseburger and a Strawberry Monster Shake is always good. Now that they have Bottomless Sweet Potato Fries, I'm extra happy about that.  Now all they need to do is add some good chili to the menu.
The service was great, we got seated right away, I highly recommend the chicken whiskey bbq. The food came out very fast and everything was fresh and hot. The waitress  was very nice.

Put our name down for a table after we were told it would be a 30-35 min wait. Over an hour later, no table, no empathy, no regard for people's time or experience. We finally get seated in a small booth and crowd in just to eat as the kids are now hungry and cranky. We order 3 waters an iced tea and a kids milk. 5 mins later, we get the milk!!!!!?????  At this point, we realize it will be another hour before we get some over priced over  done burgers that will cost a $100. At that pace we had better chance getting a pizza in 15 mins. No system, no customer service, no apologies and no one cares. Will avoid in the future.

Definitely stepped their game up! Reasonable drink specials and the food is priced right. We had an awesome server I can't believe I forgot her name. The Mai tai's are delicious and the fried zucchini is delicious!
i love red robin.. they even got a cute new bust boy xD (i think thats what he is at least)
Love the new decor and our service was amazing terry our waiter was awesome and very attentive always checking up on us and even offered us the bigger booth ( like room )

Burgers are my favorite "Go to" comfort food. With so many choices out there, a really good burger isn't that difficult to find. It's the service that makes all the difference of whether, or not, my visit is pleasant.  In general, Red Robin serves up some really tasty burgers. This particular venue had fantastic service, as well. Our server was amazingly attentive. She offered us fries while we waited, because she knew we were famished. Food arrived fairly quickly and cooked perfectly.  She made sure we had all the condiments we asked for and gave us lots of extra napkins, too!   They get 5 stars, because the overall experience was what I expected:  clean establishment, prompt greeting at the entrance, friendly service with a smile, and delicious food that was decently priced.

New Happy hour at this location!   Cool   Bar area is relatively spacious and well lit.  Has some good views outside and through the opened back of the bar.  $3 pints and wine along with some discounts on specialty drinks from 4pm to 6-7pm mon-fri.  They also have a reverse happy hour in the evening from 8pm til close.   Had a burger with french fried string onions and blue cheese and fries dipped in buttermilk ranch on special for $6.99.  Grub and suds hit the spot for a reasonable price.       One sidenote: First time I stepped into this location was a saturday evening and it was packed.  Was promptly seated by the hostess and waited for a server for 5 min, then 10 min while a few employees whisked by intently, arms firmly holding plates of food on their way to customers being helped.  I didn't want to bother them while they looked so busy.  Finally decided to walk out after about 15 minutes with a wry smile.  Honestly, I wasn't that sold on dining here anyways; no harm no foul.  Eventually decided to give them another go.  Next visit came back with a buy one get one discount.   **Free Red Robin birthday coupon good for a menu item when another item of equal or greater value is purchased.** -You get this by filling out an application on their website and they send you an email coupon you printout that has a bar code on it which you must redeem within a month but cannot reprint it, so if you lose your printout, your birthday gift coupon says later gator til your next birthday. However!  They will stay in touch via email keeping you up on what they've been up to and what all cool is happening in their Robin nest, whether you really want to hear about it or not....Reminds me why I don't have a Facebook acct -  "Not that there's anything wrong with that."   Banzai burger the menu describes as "Marinated in teriyaki & topped with grilled pineapple, Cheddar cheese, crisp lettuce, tomatoes and mayo."   Price $9.29.  Good stuff.    Bruschetta chicken sandwich which the menu describes as "grilled chicken breast with freshly prepared bruschetta salsa, pesto aioli, Provolone cheese, romaine lettuce and balsamic cream on rustic ciabatta bread."  Bread is soft and fresh, chicken grilled right and flavors combined well.  Price $10.49.  *Note to self:  Remember the ingredients and make this at home!  I can't help but chuckle because "The Robin" kinda reminds me of Applebees, which has been taking some flack in some recent comedies like Couples Retreat and Hall Pass about a stereotypical chain restaurant filled with families and kids where thirty something guys go to hangout in the bar for a cool night out.  But I ain't that guy I tell ya!  I do like their burgers. Rating breakdown.   Food:  3.75 stars Service:  3 stars (hit and miss especially when busy) Value: 3.5 stars  Average: 3.42 stars which I will round down to 3 stars for now.

My hubby and I had a great dinner here! The appetizers (O-ring shorty + Guac, Salsa & Chips) came out really quickly and were very fresh. Our waiter was funny, friendly, and attentive. Our entrees came out just after we got our appetizers (we were told that the new kitchen manager was making sure that everything was coming out super fast despite our waiter putting a delay on our entrees), but this seems minor considering my Simply Grilled Chicken burger and my hubby's Whiskey River BBQ burger were so grubby. And really, if food coming out too quickly is my biggest (and only) issue, I can't complain!

I'm usually a big fan of this place but a recent visit left a sour taste in my mouth, and I'm not talking about their Freckled Lemonade! The evening began when we showed up, the restaurant was not that busy so we thought we'd get a seat right away. Our usual preference is a booth but alas we had to wait a little bit for that. We were seated, given menus and drink orders taken. Shortly after, our waitress arrived with a big ol cheesy smile and ready to take our order. Orders placed, I mentioned to keep the fries coming (love those unlimited fries!) and she said that my statement made her nervous (oh boy, what did I get myself into?). I fully expected a basket of fries to come no more than five minutes later because that's what I've experienced in the past but no, we waited 20 mins only because our waitress saw that we didn't have our food yet and tried to make us happy (psst...the basket of fries arrived via some other waiter and he threw it on our table!) Our food finally arrived, the waitress came by asking how everything is tasting (we hadn't even taken a bite yet and I could tell hubby was getting annoyed!). Our drinks were dry and not once were we asked if we wanted a refill, we had to ask another waitress passing by!!! Overall I was very disappointed in their service this trip, I've since filled out their infamous survey and gave them a piece of my mind. Not sure if I'll return.
Graet server, nice staff, food went way down hill can't  cook frys and way over cooked burgers, don't think I will be back

Red robin has the worst service both this one and the concord location....why is there a wait when there's tons of open tables?? It's freezing in there as well. The food is usually ok not great but ok...As I'm eating my mushroom burger I see a couple little shriveled up pieces of corn. .wtf??? And bottomless fries?? Maybe if you gave more than 8 at a time wouldn't have to ask for more... bottom line I rather go eat fast food...now that's sad...
Horrible service, kitchen totally messed up a chicken sandwich. Other food came out and we finished before the chicken sandwich came back out. Guess we weren't supposed to dine together.

Food is good. Service could be a little better at times. It was not a very busy night and we asked for a booth. The stuck us in the bar area in a half booth when there were open booths in the dining area. I love that I can get a wedge salad for $3 hits the spot every time.

Bad service...long wait...cold food... missing ingredients..... And we spent over $100.00 !!! Called the general manager Shaun, he told me he would send me something for my trouble. Nothing sent ! This Red Robin is going down hill fast !!!!!

What is going on at red robin???? Waited 40 minutes to be seated. Only after I brought it to the attention of the manager. They had 16 tables cleaned and open, a few others waiting to be bussed.  and a lobby full of people, including a woman with a small baby. And elderly.  They only had 1 bus boy. So I guess there new thing is ordering from these tablets on each table. Except we didn't have one. We had to put our hungry bellys in the hands of a incompetent waitress.  Took a half hour to get our drinks, another 35 minutes to get our meal. Oh and my daughter got the Cobb salad. No dressing.  Waitress kept saying she was bringing it. Never did. Worst experience eating at a resturaunt in brentwood.  What a ruined saturday evening. We Left Upset AND Still hungry. Corporate needs to pay attention,  you can see the train wreck by reading all the yelp reviews and they seem to be getting worse the last few months.  Horrible experience

A few months ago I visited this restaurant and gave it a bad review; the service was slow, the food inedible. A couple of weeks later the manager contacted me to discuss my experience and then sent me a $25 gift card to give Red Robin a second chance.  Today we went and I am happy to report that things went much better. Our order was taken in a timely manner and our beverages and food also came in a reasonable time. The food was good (not great, but much better). We had to stop another server since ours went MIA when we wanted to pay the bill. Overall, I'd say that this is a good restaurant. Kid friendly, decent burgers, and clean.
slow service. received drinks and appetizers quickly but waited excessively long for entrees. once food arrived was pretty good, had smoke n pepper cooked medium
Soooo good! Service was good, clean area. And food was amazing the best one I've been to so far :))

3 1/2 stars. I generally like the food I have at Red Robin. Sometimes it can be a bit heavy, but I love the royal red robin and the specialty burgers. My daughter loves the adult Mac n cheese and my husband likes being able to add on things to his burger (extra bacon, jalapeños). Love the service as well. Most of the time, servers are very attentive and nice.  I think the prices are a little high though.  Women's bathroom needs work.  Stalls so small you can barely pull down your pants and when you wipe you hit your head on the door. In the two non handicap stalls you can see the other stall through the toilet paper roll area very clearly. Not good since the restaurant is kid friendly. Not to mention, the woman folk who don't really want others seeing their lady parts.  Finally, paper towel comes out one millimeter at a time making hand drying a difficult albeit amusing experience.

This place was ookay.  Nothing special . Service was decent, food wasn't all that amazing but it wasn't nasty. I was able to get a free meal since I had used my red royalty card. After 10 meals you get a free one. It's part of their rewards program. Not bad for rarely using my card. Restaurant was clean, and had pleasant people working. The only thing I did not like was the salad. Their 1000 island dressing tasted different, didn't make the salad all that awesome like I was hoping .

I got a cheeseburger with bacon and guacamole. Well, the first bite I take, I drank my whole glass of water and my sisters. It was HOTT. I asked the waitress if it was supposed to be hot, she said "no it is supposed to be mild". My friend tried the burger and was about to puke. It was so hot it got to the point to where we almost puked. We tell the waitress, and all she does is gets me a new bun. Come on, a new bun? Really? We only took 2 bites, it wouldn't hurt to give me another one -_-.  The new bun didn't help at all. I left with no food in my stomach and disappointed.

The only reason we come here is because of the kids and my wife likes the maragritas.  Although its been remodeled and looks better, they need to focus on the staff and their less than mediocre service.  There are a couple of very good servers, but the rest are lousy and inexperienced and don't care about their jobs.  Our food always comes out cold and the fries are NEVER consistent, either too soggy or overcooked and they never serve you with enough fries and when you ask for more, you get maybe ten fries just before you pay your bill.  The "bottomless" fries is just a gimmick, they do their best to limit you.  The burgers are always cold or "luke warm" and are very dry.  When the cook plates the food and rings for service, the servers are nowhere to be found and the food sits on the deck forever.  Less chatting and more work is definitely a problem.  I don't order the burgers anymore, just the BBQ wrap, which is a no brainer, you cant screw that up, at least they haven't yet.  You can tell that the general manager could care less, no responses to any of these reviews apologizing, hey that's the American way right, get paid to do nothing.

Horrible service tonight! We were there about two hours! They messed up multiple times on our orders and didn't even bring my husbands side out with his meal, after waiting about 10 minutes we finally said just forget it. The food was good but it's more worth it to do take out then dining in.  Not worth the tip.

been there twice with my wife. first time was an amazing experience. made my own burger and everyone thought it was unbelievable, which it was. they were all friendly and even had a since of humor about my "artery clogging"  burger. second time was not so much the same. seemed like they lost everything I loved about the place. everyone seemed so serious and non talkative. was a very awkward experience. would give 3 stars for that but my first experience was worth way more than 5 stars. get the pep back in your step! its what made you special!

Food is good service was ok. Our server was very nice but kept asking us the same thing over and over. I don't know if I can handle that all night! Burger were delicious and cheese sticks were the bomb too!
Had to wait 50 minutes for our food but Manager came up without being asked and apologized saying that our meal was on them. Good Management when they realized they lost an order.
I always get the Bonzi buffer but this time I tried the bbq chicken wrap. I was blown away! I love red robin in Brentwood or anywhere I go!

Returning to the Bay Area from a long trip, about 15 of us stopped by to get a quick bite.  The hostess mentioned it would be a 10 minute wait, which seemed appropriate given our party size.  After about half an hour, we inquired about our wait given the restaurant was nearly empty.  We were told they were in the process of preparing our table and to give them another 10 minutes. After almost an hour into this and a few very hungry kids, we again asked what the hold up was.  At this point the hostess informed us that a waitress had just quit and they could not seat us until another waitress showed up!  I asked if another waiter could take our order, as I noticed at least six or seven waiters not really busy.  The hostess asked that I speak to the manager, who was no help and basically kicked us out.  When I got a little upset and unfortunately started to raise my voice he told me I was trespassing and he was going to call the police?  Luckily we walked over to BJ's next door and had a great quick lunch.  We mentioned our odd experience with our hostess at BJ's, and he mentioned that they frequently get angry customers coming from that red robins.  Don't know how places like that stay in business with service like that, but in the end it worked out for us.

Dined around 9 pm on Valentines day, by myself,  but the point is that it was a busy night, yet, service, drinks and food was fast and very good; I had the Ultimate Margarita and the Ensenada Chicken platter. My table was on the greasy side however. Bathroom was very clean.

This was my first time here at the restaurant, as I had their burgers in Foster City and Los Angeles before.  The sign of a good chain restaurant is when they can deliver consistent quality regardless of location, and this particular restaurant successfully accomplished that.  My favorite is the Banzai burger (pineapple with teriyaki sauce) and again it was yummy, cooked to our request.  The service was good and the quality, quantity, and price of the meal were reasonable.  I will definitely eat at Red Robin again.

Nice lunch experience.  The wait to be seated was very short. I has the Cobb salad and my husband had the grilled chicken sandwich with endless fries. My salad was large and delicious.  The server was friendly and professional.  .   I think she is the bartender as we were in that area. She checked on us at the right intervals.  The music volume was appropriate as opposed to a place we visited on Friday.  Overall I enjoyed the experience and will go back.
Standard food. The place was a little messy when I got seated but they took care of it. Service was very quick and attentive.

Best place for a meal! 1) be sure to ask to be seated in Christa's area 2) be sure to sign up for the 'Red Royalty Rewards' card (free burgers)! 3) awesome for: dates, business, alone, friends, families, birthdays, anniversaries.... OR JUST BECAUSE THEY ARE GREAT

Service is hit and miss but the food has always been consistent if you like Red Robin you'll like your meal.  Nice location too since there are not many big name chain restaurants in east coco county.

Red Robin is a chain I really like ... ok, love. I've been to locations all over the greater Bay Area and the bottomless seasoned steak fries make me happy every time.  I usually order a Whiskey River BBQ turkey burger or chicken breast sandwich -- the meat is moist, tender and well cooked, and the topping flavors come together well -- crispy onions, bbq sauce and a sesame seed bun. One of my favorite burger experiences. Oh, if you appreciate a good, fattening ranch dressing like I do, you'll like theirs for sure.  It's very buttermilk-y! I'm subtracting one star for the decor and atmosphere.  It really is a corny looking, family type restaurant.  One your average hipster yelper wouldn't dare be seen in ... but, if you can go with the flow, let your hair down, break the rule of patronizing a chain restaurant, I'm betting you'll actually have a pretty good time.  And, if you're struggling to do that while you're there, note that they have an extensive cocktail menu.
The food is alright, but our server was cool and kept the unlimited fries coming before we needed to ask...so bonus for that! =] lol

Poor service the last few times I've been here, and the food was disappointing as well.  Soggy burgers that were also a wee bit undercooked, watery drinks.  Too expensive for such a lackluster eating experience.

First time ordering to go. When my husband brought the food back it was missing quite a bit. The BBQ salad did not have avacado, onion strings, tortilla chips or BBQ sauce drizzled on the chicken. The onion rings were almost burnt I asked them to put the dressing on the side. I also asked for 2 extra dips for the onion rings. What I got was 5 sides of salad dressing 1 side of black beans 1 little side of bbq sauce. Wow!  How can something so easy get so screwed up. I called and spoke to someone who said they would keep my name there for the next time I ordered. Do I dare? Eating at the restaurant has never been to bad  but not sure I will ever do take out again..
Bring your sweater regardless the season.  This pace is always cold. I like their salads but can't stand being cold while eating.  Steve the bartender/server is great on customer service.

I LOVE RED ROBIN!!! But upper management really needs to be made aware of this particular site. IT IS AWFUL! I have been to this location a few times with my family. The f 1st time, we got seated relatively quickly, But once we were seated were never talked to again. We waited 25 minutes and no one came by to even get our drink order. So we got up and went to BJs across the parking lot. On our way out the manager asked why were leaving and she said she would help us now, i told her it was too late for that and we left. We decided to give this place another try a couple months later. JUST AS BAD. Our server had no idea what he was doing, service was lousy, food was slow, wrong and cold. Although, we did make some new friends that night. The surrounding tables and us were all very disappointed in the service, and we all had a blast complaining to one another bout it. Haven't gone back since the 3rd time we went and everything was the same. Lousy customer service, no urgency with customer orders just awful.
2 of us just sat in a booth for 10 mins. No one came to take an order for drinks or food. Went to the front desk asked for a wait  person, waited for another 10 mins no one came and we left.

We have gone to several Red Robins throughout northern California, and even this one SEVERAL times when it first opened ...  Let me see here, well .... The last time we went a couple of months ago, we were told that there is a limit on the unlimited fries, the manager gave the lamest excuse I have ever heard .... "We only get a set amount of fries, and we cannot just put fries out waiting to be picked up .... Our fries have a 3 minute shelf life".  Fries with a "Shelf Life" yeah right.  We complained to the corporate office, and got a call from the General Manager asking us about our horrible experience .... He in turn sent us a $25 gift card, with a personalized letter stating that what the manager told us is bogus .... Hopefully he canned her ass, because it was obvious at the time she had told other customers the same thing.  I can go on and on, but simply put this place SUCKS !

Red Robin has always been decent food. If your hungry and want a burger that's nothing special then this is the place for you. The service is great which is why I gave them three stars, our server took very good care of us and was always very prompt to refill our drinks and check if we needed anything. Price wise your looking at average cost for a night out, just like a chilis or any other restaurant chain. All in all I would not frequent here often, there are much better food choices in town.

Took an hour for our food. We watched it sit on the food line for 10 minutes. You could imagine our shock when it came to our table cold (all of it). The manager proceeded to be defensive about the situation, not customer service friendly.  It was simple, we just didn't want cold soup and fries.  We did get a discount, but that's over an hour of my time.

Worst service ever!!! The Manager is un equipped with the skills to manage this restaurant. Once we got inside we had to find our own table while they served other people. It's been an hour and a half and we still haven't gotten our food yet. I'd suggest another restaurant! A child got sick inside the lobby and the staff didn't address it until we moved a caution sign and spoke to the manager

Food was ok.  Service was horrible!  Took forever to get our drinks.   Me my wife and one child took 2 hours on a Wednesday at 6pm to have dinner.  Horrible.  Bathroom was a mess also.  Needs improvement fast!!!

We've tried it three times, and I'm in no hurry to go back. On trips I've been to a couple Red Robins in other areas and to be truthful I'm not a huge fan.  I do not enjoy burgers so overstuffed that food is falling everywhere, so even though I think some of their flavor combos are fun and their fries are pretty tasty, I rarely choose to eat here.  Still, when one moved into Brentwood I was happy to have another option close to the shopping center and movie theature. The first time we went service was pretty slow, but the restaurant was almost brand new so we gave it a pass.  I don't remember exactly what we ordered, but the food was fine. Second time I made the mistake of ordering a fish sandwich.  Once I got it the sandwich was very tasty...once I got it.  We watched other tables sit, give their order, get their food, and leave before I got my sandwich!  I would have been happy to reorder something else if the fish sandwich was so terribly difficult to make, but was never given the opportunity.  We just keep being told "It's on its way out."  I know it was my sandwich too because while my sandwich was good, my husband and daughter's burgers had that soggy bun "under the lamps too long" yuk going on. Third visit, just my husband and I, and we decide to split the onion rings appetizer.  They tasted...okay...but later that night we were both sick as dogs. For whatever reason this parking lot is always full to overflowing, so someone must be happy here, but it sure isn't me.  I hope that as they keep adding more restaurants to the area this place will either step up its game to compete or will go out of business.

If I could have given 0 stars I would have. This is my 4th time coming here and it has gone downhill more each time. But last night, I finally got the umph I needed to write this review. First off, let me say I was with my husband and two children, 6 and 8. We got there at 7 and we were seated immediately but warned of a wait. We were fine with it though, had just come from a movie, had popcorn! I headed to use restroom, disgusting. Overflowing trash, no toilet paper and I could see in the stall through the toilet paper holder (luckily my daughter). Immediately our easter told us because of the wait we could have dessert for free.....I thought that was weird since we had just sat down. Anyways, ordered food. It took 1 hour for it to come. 4 burgers....so...clearly not that hard. I looked at the kitchen, cooks were eating french fries and drinking while cooking. Also, one was rubbing eyes and face and then placed food on plate with bare hands. The waiter was holding a plate to the lamp to reheat before serving....it was quite a sight. Finally our meals came, which I was already turned off. I got my burger, cut in half, it was bloody. I ordered "well well done". I sent it back, refused to pay for it. Decided to skip eating. After waiting another 30 minutes for receipt we were told we could check out on kiosk. It is the LAST time I will give red Robin my business.....especially since they are charging $14 foe a burger. I suggest you do the same.

God where to start. Me and a large group of colleagues all decided to go and get a bite to eat and since red robin has good food and reasonable prices we deiced to go there. Big mistake. Now i understand that there was 15 of us and its not easy to find a table for everyone together but that particular day was not at all busy and there was a long stretch of tables that were cleaned an ALL empty right at the time we arrived. However it took the hostess 1 1/2 hours to give us the tables even when no one sat there the entire time we waited. After that we finally got to order and surprisingly the food came pretty quickly, but after we got the food there was a reason it had come so quickly. Three peoples chicken burgers were frozen! The fries we received were cold and hard, and one of us never received the food that they put on his bill. We sent the frozen burgers back after taking to a particularly rude waitress and asked for a refund since we had not gotten what we order and had underdone fries and chicken. The manager was particularly rude and never gave us compensation for the food, however they did bring back fully cooked burgers and fries for those who had received frozen ones. Still would eat at red robin just not this particular location.

We frequent this place often and have always had a great experience,  servers are friendly and on task! Its refreshing to see servers who take it upon themselves to keep an eye on your drinks and make sure its topped off.  If you have never had the campfire sauce with your fries TRY it... delicioso ..! I had the Burning Love Burger it was juicy tasty just overall great the crispy jalapenos make for a slight kick of spicy but just the perfect amount mouth watering goodness..  Most definitely 4 solid stars !!!
