I'm not a big fan of chain restaurants, but this particular Red Robin impressed me.  The last time I went to Red Robin was probably like 2004, to the Concord location.   Upon entering this location, I liked how open the layout was, with the bar occupying one part and a lot of booths and tables occupying the opposite side.  We were greet cheerily by the hostess and led to our table.  A friendly waiter arrived promptly and got our drinks going.   We ordered up a couple of burgers and had the onion ring stack.  Everything came out as ordered and well-cooked, but nothing really striking to write home about (not necessarily a bad thing). This is about as tops of an experience as you can get for standard fare in a volume-oriented restaurant.  Lots of parking, prices not bad, friendly staff, quick service.  I've got no qualms about going back.

Another option to eat in the area before watching a movie. Food is basic but still good. Haven't had problems with them making drinks. Strawberry lemonade is also a plus. Prepare as it can get busy when it's movie night. Nice to have the unlimited fries.

Red Robin! YUM! My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday after I got off of work and it was amazing! Our server was super friendly and so easy to chat with. I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap and my boyfriend ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Cheeseburger. They were both delicious as well as the fries. We both ended up ordering drinks, I had a Mai Tai and he had a beer. They were both great. The funny part was that my boyfriend ended up getting the last slice of orange for his beer. Definitely coming to this location more often!
Really they have plenty of seats , but ONLY seat in order of sections!  Wow so much about customer being first. Tell the "divas" of servers to chill.
Food, fantasic.. servers are smart asses, but I am too so that's ok!  The Teryaki Chicken burger is TO DIE FOR and of course their fries are excellent!

Will never go back. I've had 2 awful experiences there, including have cold food come out, been ignored by waiters, had drinks made wrong, had food come out wrong. And on top of it all, not even a "sorry" from anyone and charged for everything.

Ok. Service first. Samantha C. Jessica, and ok..... even manager Steve went all out for our party of 13. Father's Day lunch.  Pretty busy.  A few mistakes but all by the kitchen and one computer.  Thanks to those 3 we all had a good time.  Missing one of the youngest ones.  The services were yesterday so it's still fresh.  Everyone is exhausted.  We never mentioned that to anyone here so I know this is their regular routine.  So thank you you 3. As for the food. ... average.  Nothing to write home about.  But an average restaurant can do quite well with the right folks serving customers.  Good job guys. And the birthday song was great too!

The burgers, the never ending fries are enough for three stars.  It goes to four stars because I was in a party that slammed them Sunday evening.  The servers were great in managing an ever increasing party size.  They didn't miss a beat, gave great service, and even made the birthdays folks feel special.

Just came of this place . So disappointed with the service.server gave us our drinks but waited almost 20 minutes, food never came out. Asked her again and she answered our was first in line. Hope your management sees this so your other customers don't  experience this.

After living in Tucson for 12 years, you start to like some chain restaurants and Red Robin was one I was always a big fan of. My mom and I would make the 40 minute drive, sometimes solely to go and eat there. So I was incredibly disappointed after my experience there tonight. We walked in around 8:50 and there was still quite a few diners there however there was no seating hostess to be found. An older lady from the bar approached my boyfriend and I, and I asked if we could be seated at a half booth. She then asked if I wanted just a booth, and I repeated that I'd like a half booth half table. At that point the actual hostess appeared and I repeated my request. She led us first to the left side of the restaurant where there wasn't an actual table where we could be seated. She took us back to the front of the restaurant and told us to hold on so she could clear off a different table on the other side of the dining room. She seated us and was very nice so I thought, 'okay this isn't so bad.'  We were seated relatively close to the kitchen so we were able to hear some chit chat from that area, which was fine until one of the waitresses started swearing profusely about having to split a check. She was clearly very upset (understandable as waiting isn't an easy job) but there is a time and place to vent such frustrations and as a customer I shouldn't be able to hear it. Throughout our time there she sat at a table behind us with three other waitresses (they were supposedly rolling silverware) and she was being loud and complaining the whole time. At one point a manager approached and told them that they needed to get up, to which she responded with something like 'It's been a really long night, I shouldn't even be rolling silverware.' I just couldn't believe she was behaving in such a way. The customer service industry isn't easy, but it's a job and if you don't like it then you should probably find another one.  The entire time we were there, all the tables around us that had had diners remained covered in plates and dirty napkins. It wasn't until I was walking out the door that a single buser came to clean off the table tops. No one else considered it worthwhile. I've never seen tables at a restaurant stay dirty for anywhere near that amount of time.  Our waitress came and took our drink orders and then came back for our diner orders. However, once our food came out, my basket was full to the brim and my boyfriend's looked sad and empty. He had 8 fries, whereas I had at least 20. Our waitress never spoke directly to my boyfriend, never refilled his drink or asked about his food. I had to ask her to refill his drink and to bring us more fries. He felt pretty badly about the lack of consideration and acknowledgment he received and actually left the restaurant to wait in the car. I went to speak with the manager who at first wasn't very approachable. She said she would check on our order of fries and come back out. I went back to our table (the fries had already come out) and waited for her. I couldn't see her in the kitchen, so I decided to leave. On the way out I approached the same older lady who had come to seat us earlier so that she could let the manager know that we got our fries and I had left. She basically dismissed me with a look and so I left. I will NEVER return to this Red Robin again. I am absolutely appalled by the way they treat their customers. Luckily I live in an area where unless it is late (which is why we went to Red Robin in the first place) there are many delicious food options. This experience really left a bad taste in my mouth for not only Red Robin but for chain restaurants as a whole. If being a chain means that employees think that they can put in less work then I don't care to spend my money there.

Ok, somehow these buffoons lost our appetizer order and the moon was setting over England before we received it. So once we were able to finally track down our waitress, she bought out this appetizer meal that looked nothing like what we ordered.....annnnnndddd it was cold (WTF). Now after all that it took another round of the clock before our main meals were served, and they were cold......again? WTF! Now the wife was pissed off to the highest point of pissitivity......pissing off a hungry woman (my wife) is not good, someone had to feel the wrath. The manager got a ear full. Now this moron tells the wife that he will make her a new burger and new fries....why did this MUtha Fucka bring back some luke warm fries and a reheated burger! How we know it was reheated, the damn bun was soggy on the bottom and the top was now a little crusty.......The manager took 50% off our bill which did nothing for us, we were able to afford the meal. this place is a real POS!

I think they have a pretty tasty Turkey & Green Chile Club thing.  Fries are good also.  But let's be honest about their "Bottomless Fries"...  They are slow as hell in refilling them.  And I love fries.  If they actually kept your fry barrel from showing a bottom, then I would probably 5 star it.

My husband and I have tried this place around 5 times. Each time the wait staff was good but the kitchen sucked. It took forever to get our food and this last time we were there (yesterday) was no exception.  Once again the waiter Marc was awesome but the kitchen somehow lost our food ticket and the restaurant wasn't even busy, we went in there at 4pm.  The manager was nice and gave us a discount and free appetizers but by the time our free appetizers showed up our food was already there :-/ The manager explained that the burger side of the kitchen had 6 veterans working and was flawless however all the food we ordered was from the other side of the kitchen and had 3 people working it with less than 6 months experience in food. I don't understand why you would put all your veteran cooks on one side of the kitchen but OK.  I asked for LIGHT MAYO and half my sandwich had it and the other half was slathered with it, so I only ate half my sandwich. Sigh. Even tho the manager tried to redeem the restaurant my husband and I both agreed we will not be going back there ever again.  On a side note we are dying for Black Angus to open!!!!!! It will be nice to have a real non uppity steak house in our area!

Came here with a girlfriend. Right when we walked in every table was covered in dirty dishes. Waitresses if not talking to their tables for 2seconds were standing around talking. I was told not to get the french dip because it took to long to make. They switched waitresses in the middle of our dinner and the other one was just as bad. She didnt even clear the table the two times she asked if we needed drinks refilled. We had to flag her down and after 30 min had to go get the check myself. The little electronic device that I just had to touch to pay for my check was so disgusting and covered with food. When I asked why all the tables were dirty she said bus boy was on break... We looked at her like why are you and your other employees standing around instead of cleaning? The food was only tolerable because I was starving. The only thing that was good was the cake that was probably pre made. DO NOT WASTE TIME AND MONEY GOING TO THIS RED ROBIN. Go to a mom and pop restaurant instead... You get better customer service and food.
Guacamole bacon burger and fries. I tried the wings with the island sauce was really good. The server was great.

Love the fries and the option for gluten free food. One of my favorite restaurants! The older waitress who often wears bandanas on her head is VERY rude! I have been rudely treated on 3 separate occasions! We will not sit in her section.
Love Red Robin. Love that you can substitute fries for Mac n cheese. Love their burgers. Love their bottomless strawberry lemonade. Soooo good.

By far the worst customer service I've had in a very long time! I'm generally a pretty patient person when it comes to restaurants especially when they are busy. However, tonight when we went there we had a terrible experience. It didn't take that long to be seated, but after that it took over 30 minutes for anyone to even show up at our table. There were tables that arrived after us who received their food before we even got to order. After finally getting to place our order we waited for over an hour for our food without anyone to even refill our drinks. We had to stop random servers to ask for different things we needed because we didn't really have one. We finally got our food and I asked for the check right away. Sure enough, that came quickly, however took another 30 minutes for someone to take our payment. Even then, another 20 minutes to get our change. Very dissatisfied with the service at this restaurant and most likely will not return nor recommend to others.

My husband and I have now given Red Robin four separate chances to make a better impression on us. We have always liked their food, but each time we have been here, the service is HORRIBLE!! Sit for at least ten minutes before you get your drink order in, then wait for at least 45 minutes for your food. We have tried talking to the manager on two different occasions, and they always try the same excuse of being understaffed.

My wife and went there to have somrthing other than a burger. That was a mistake. I ordered the Baja  Club and my wife ordered the BLTA. Red Robin has great burgers. My sandwich was overloaed with mayo and the bacon was not cooked. I bought a combo with soup and the soup was cold. I sent it back and they put it into the microwave and runined the dish, There was hardly any chicken and veg in the soup. The crossaint on my wifes dish was cold just a bit of toasting would have been a breakthough. It is obvious that the cooks don't give a crap about what they put out.The server was too involved about getting his bar set for the day.

Hire more cooks! How can I word this review.... Well, "Cooks Needed" My wife, myself, grown kids and grand-kids were enjoying a beautiful day at the streets of Brentwood. We decided to have lunch at Red Robins. As we entered, there was no hostess. We patiently waited for about 4 minutes and the poor Hostess looked overwhelmed. I told her that I had a party of 7 adults and 2 small ones. Here is when we took the next exit off this freeway.. The hostess indicated to us that she can seat us, but, it may take some time to be served because the kitchen is slammed and they are really behind in orders.... I looked around and saw that the amount of folks eating couldn't be more than 50..I asked, this is a restaurant right? You do serve food, right? She answered yes to both questions but, reiterated that the kitchen is way backed up and any orders will be delayed. You know, here's a business that caters to people eating and ordering foods, but, they are in dire straights when consumers have to be told that the kitchen is real backed up!  I know let's make box lunches and serve this as an emergency back up when the kitchen is slammed and can't handle a flow of customers..."

Sad to hear they changed birthday burger. I know it is a free burger during the birthday month but of all the times I have come to redeem mine I've always been allowed to choose a sandwich instead; not today :( was informed by Angel this has never been allowed but yet I've ALWAYS done this--- I guess no more Red Robin on my b-day.....
Went to dinner for our son's birthday. Over an hour and a half... Sevice was poor, food cold and lots of finger pointing. Very disappointing. They forgot his birthday...Really!

This place is probably the most horribly managed restaurant in the east bay. So a waitress comes by to fill our drinks and she pours water all over the table, creating a gigantic mess of water across both myself and the table, as well as a huge puddle on the ground where the water is falling onto. Normally I wouldn't be bothered too much by this, as mistakes happen. But the waitress looks at it, says nothing and walks away. No apologies, no "I'll be right back," nothing. So I assume she's on her way to clean up the mess, except 10 minutes goes by and she never comes to clean it up. Obviously irate by this, I called the manager over. The manager did not offer an apology or any form of compensation, offering the excuse that the waitress was new and had not yet been properly trained to clean it up when she makes a mess. Are you kidding me? I left a $0.00 tip, deservedly so. I've never seen such incompetent management at any restaurant. I guess whenever anybody spills something or makes a mess in life then they're completely screwed unless red robin has properly trained them to clean it up.

I've stopped at Red Robin over the years. I've seen some great changes and some I didn't like. But I do do like their burgers. This was the first time I stopped at this Brentwood location. It was a Sunday afternoon and the place was busy. I opted to sit at the bar and order food. I ordered the Pig Out Tavern burger and a beer. It did seem like it was a little slow in getting my order. But the burger was good and so were the fries. Personally, I prefer skinny fries, but these are OK. My only real complaint was that there was a cold draft where I was sitting. I ended up putting my jacket on to eat. The front door was closed so I don't know where the draft was coming from. I do think their prices are a little high. If I'm in the area again, I will probably try somewhere else to eat before coming here again. That doesn't mean this place is no good...I just think I can get more bang for my buck elsewhere. If you are set on getting a good burger, you should give this place a try.
Excellent food. Sometimes there's not enough staff and service is slow.  Bartenders are good, especially Steve.
This location is crap ghetto. Bad service with attitude. Unorganized and dirty. Crossing off list foever.

Went there yesterday for lunch around 1:30, three of us.  Very nice waiter and gave us great suggestions.  Received our app and beverages, very prompt.  Next thing there is a disturbance behind us and next we are told is our waiter was sent home.  Went down hill from there.  Took way too long to get our food, salad was room temp (all I ordered), one order was wrong and had to get a whole new one.  All 3 of us got our meals at different times and had to ask twice for my salad dressing.  Dishes were still there from when we had apps and first round of drinks.  The service  was embarrassing.  Waiter that had to step up was fine but way over extended.  Now the bathroom...all 3 stalls had stuff floating (gross) and only 1 stall had toilet paper and no ass gaskets.  Had to use that one, could not hold it anymore.  I am 5'10 and my knees were an inch from the door, had to straddle the toilet to sit down.  Do my thing and the toilet wont flush.  We spoke to the manager, the frowny face lady with a beard, and she just said we had to handle our business, basically "oh well".  Didn't offer to comp anything and walked off.  I  will never return to this dump again.

Some of the servers are great, some aren't. Some of the time I get the right order, and sometimes my food is missing ingredients. I don't know what to expect when I come here... but hey, bottomless fries.

The burgers are great but service is a bit slow. Service makes or breaks my experiences in a town as small as Brentwood. Don't get me wrong, the people are great but management can step up their game by working with the young servers... Strawberry lemonade is the bomb and the burgers definitely hit the spot!

Seated quickly, our server was awesome! I would avoid the bacon aioli unless you dont like bacon. Other than that, everything was really great! We told oir server we didnt like the bacon dip and he took it off the bill. Other places ive been you have to fight router and nail to get them to remove something. But David was awesome

We were going to go to Mel's which was too busy as theater folks seem to congregate there so went to Red Robin instead. We've been here many times and have always enjoyed the food. Hamburgers are a little pricey but it's not fast food and the taste is pretty good. The bottomless fries are guaranteed to fill you up and taste good too although they don't always seem to get them to you as fast as you want. This trip was better and the server was pretty prompt in filling up refills for sodas and fries. In general, a nice place to have a tasty burger or other basics such as salads and sandwiches. No problems when we've taken our grandkids here too as it's a very family friendly place.

Christa is a wonderful server. Very understanding and made my dinner perfect to my liking. She was charismatic, understanding, helpful, funny, and just plane adorable. She makes this whole establishment worth while. She deserves a raise and a big tip. Even on a Saturday evening when it is jam packed. She managed to check in on me periodically. Made my special Accommodations in food preparation Perfect, and Asked if anything needed changed or modify to Let her know.  She know's what she's doing, Knows the Menu well, and will help you in any way you need. The Red Royalty Burger was Scrumptious.  You must Be seated with Christa.

My husband and I recently went here for lunch and although the service was not great I chose to go back today because I was craving their BLTA croissant and fries. I took my 5-year old daughter with me and we were seated right away. Our uninterested waitress came to take our drink and food order, and after I received my water (without the lemon I requested) our waitress never returned to check on us. It took 30 minutes for me to receive my lunch order (my daughter didn't want anything so it was just the one plate) and I literally watched as my sandwich sat on the food line for at least 12 minutes. My sandwich was soggy and the fries were cold and tasted a day old. I received one water refill from another waitress passing by and yet another waitress eventually brought my food over. Each time I saw my waitress pass, she never made eye contact so I couldn't wave her over. Finally, as I'm halfway through the sandwich I'm forcing myself to eat, our waitress comes over to see if we need anything, so I ask for the campfire sauce I originally requested with my order but did not receive. It took a few minutes, but she eventually brought it. Overall, we were there for an hour for one lousy meal. Luckily, my daughter was very patient. In addition to MY poor experience: As I was watching the food line I saw another waitress poking her finger into a cheeseburger that I assume she was about to serve to another patron. I would have let the manager know if I could get anyones attention, but it was impossible to even get a passing glance.

Red Robin? YUM. Go here often and enjoy every time. Hint - fries are bottomless so if you ask for them before you order, they come as an "appetizer" except you aren't charged extra :-). There's a website you can "create" your own burger/ meal before you go and then order your customized creation when you get there.

Busy busy busy location. On a Friday evening at 7:00 p.m. we only had a 35 minute wait which isn't too bad. This isn't the place to go if you like quiet. Their were alot of kids playing the games near the entrance, and running around. We paid no mind...we just wanted to give it a try. There was a T.V. in the floor in the entrance waiting area which was interesting. I had the Blackened Chicken and is was very tasty. Messy tasty...need alot of napkins. My friend had a burger and loved it. The garlic fries were not very garlicky at all compared to other locations. The adult lemonades were great.  I have to say even with the crowd, hungry people, and the wait...the waitresses were great. I felt bad for the hostess. She got yelled at by a customer because someone hadn't heard their name called to get seated.  This place has only been open a week and I think her mic broke. Geeesh!
Foods usually always good service usually always ssssllllooowwwwwwww...ohhh oooh oohhh oohhh oohhh
Horrible service.... Had to clear my own table of dishes. My wife's veggy burger was so over peppered she had trouble finishing.  Used to be consistent foodWon't ever go back!
As usual burgers are great! From place to place the food is always good. The service is not so good here. I always seem to get forgotten about or my food comes out last or sometimes no at all!

Overall 5 star for the food, but MARC was our server and never checked on us, took almost 20 mins to get one extra order of fries. While waiting on the fries, he Passed our table 8 times and never got us refills on our empty drinks that was sitting on the edge of the table in plain site... Shame on MARC..

First off we we seated at a table that had a huge mess under the table.  Wtf...  I told the manager (very nice)and she felt bad. We were here when it first opened for friends and family night.   Free food & drinks yay......   Now it's a few months later an we are back.   Jd was our server. Cool dude but he never brought us drink refills. Then he asked me to hand him the pepper shaker so he could clean it while I was eating.   Great 80's music. Food was decent (usually better)  I had the southwest pasta, very soso.  Salad was very good. My gf had the chicken sandwich that was overly smokey. Service & food is usually better, must have been an off night. CLEAN THE PLACE !!!!!

Came here for lunch and it was pretty busy. Many moms with children, as I was taking my sis in law, my son and niece out for lunch. Our server was awesome right of the bat. Very polite and willing. I had received their special frequent card thing a while back and so we were able to get a free appetizer :)  Stacked onion rings: sooo delish! Nice thick onion slices with crispy breading. Not a fan of their lil special sauce it tasted like ranch with BBQ sauce blaaaah!  -chicken caprese sandwich:  chicken sandwich on a ciabatta bread with fresh mozzarella cheese and some kind of pesto sauce in it!! oMG!! I loved it. The way the mozzarella was melting.. Yumm my mouth is watering just talking about it. Def a must!!  -bruschetta chicken sandwich: which is also another yummo!!!!  To go order of their Royal Red burger basically a hamburger with egg on top which my bf liked alot!  We also can't forget their bottomless fries!!  Red robin is awesome! Even better with their frequent card where if u buy 8 sandwiches u get the 9th free and also a free sandwich on ur birthday!!

It was ok. Food was a little salty and greasy but what can you expect right? The bill came out to be around $52 and a little more for tip. We only ordered one milkshake, 3 sodas, 2 soups and 3 entrees.  A little pricey for ok food. The fish for the the fish and chips meal had no flavor, rubbery consistency that made me think the fish wasn't fresh... bleh. The one down in LA is much better.

Great burgers!  My wife ordered a great mushroom cheeseburger (I know, I "tasted" it).  The kids ordered pizzas. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger.  Taking my first bite, I noticed something missing... no bacon.  The waitress was apologetic and returned with an order of bacon on the side.  Yeah! The bottomless lemonades were great, too!
The food is OKAY at this particular location. I've enjoyed their food better at other locations in the bay area.
Not much of a fan. In my opinion its ok, on a "hungry-I don't have time to go elsewhere-I'm already here" kind of day. Burgers are ok. Pasta is bland. Not a place I will go back to willingly .

Food was ok, fires are always cold. Service leaves little to desire, no eating utensils when food is served, waited forever to get some had to almost beg for the utensils. Drinks were never refilled and endless fries means only one basket so make them last.

Met an old friend for lunch today because Brentwood was a good halfway point for us. I had only eaten at Red Robin like once before and it was a while ago so I did not really remember the menu. I have to say I was not impressed both by their selection or by the taste of the food. I think that is the reason I have not gone back. My memory was refreshed.  After staring at the menu for what seemed like forever I finally made a selection. They pretty much have burgers, sandwich, and salads none of which sounded that great. I finally settled on the Guacamole Bacon Burger and chose Mac and Cheese for the side instead of the fries. I enjoy eating and when I have to settle on something at a restaurant that is usually not a good sign. I can usually find something I actually want to try. Well the burger was a huge disappointment. The bacon just looked gross and tasted just as gross so I took it off. The guacamole was devoid of any flavor and so was the meat. So basically what I had was an overpriced flavorless burger. I asked for a side of pickles and they made the burger tolerable and I ate about half of it. The Mac and Cheese, however, was really good. I am glad I ordered that as a side. I ate all of that. The customer service was ok for the most part. Nothing outstanding or memorable. When I wanted a Dr. Pepper I had to flag someone down because our waiter was nowhere to be found. Would I go back? Probably not. I do not mean just this specific location but Red Robin in general. I just don't like their food selection. Nothing seemed that good to me. We have one in my hometown of Manteca so I do have access if I wanted to go.  I prefer small hole in the wall places to big chain restaurants to start off with and if I do go to chain restaurant I can think of quite a few that I know I like alot better than this place. If I ever go back to a Red Robin again it will be at someone else's choosing; like for their birthday or something. Other than that I would choose to eat elsewhere.

Terrible terrible service! Went in last night, first time for us, there was a 20-25 min wait, yet numerous empty tables needing bussed. Sat in bar area, service and food was terrible! Will not go back!
I like this new location of Red Robin. It's clean, employees are nice. My favorite waitress is Trish - she is a hoot!  And, the bottomless fries are fantastic.
I like this place theres a lot going on with the decor. the food is pretty good too, haven't been disappointed yet. the waiters/waitresses are on the ball.

My husband and I finally had a night away from the kids and decided to try a new place.  Headed to Red Robin since I hadn't been to one in years.  What a disappointment! While we were seated quickly, our waiter basically threw our menus at us and walked away.  It wasn't busy but he was rushing around like the place was packed.  Came back a few minutes to take our order.  When my husband asked the difference between the small Guiness and the large Guiness, he rolled his eyes and said, one is 28 oz. and one is 35 oz.'  Wow, sorry for asking.  Food came out in a timely manner but again, he seemed in a hurry and rushed off.  Never came to see if we needed anything else and gave us our check about 10 minutes after we received our meals.  Needless to say, we will not be going here again.  Spent $50 on a dinner we were rushed through.  BTW, went to In-n-Out a few days later, spent $10 and were much happier with our exerience and our food.

I've been to a few RR's but this was my first trip to the one in Brentwood.   It was a Saturday night yet the service was quick, friendly and efficient.  The food was great.  I had the A1 Peppercorn burger (yum), one friend had a teriyaki chicken salad (looked really great), and my other freind who had a turkey burger commented that most places don't season turkey burgers, but this one was and she really liked it.  We got a slice of mud pie for dessert which was HUGE and plenty for 4 of us.

Love me some Red Robbin, don't eat there a lot but when I do it's always delicious. I love the tortilla soup and the chicken sandwich oh so good. Also, like to get the endless fries with a refreshing strawberry lemonade! Nice staff, clean family oriented place good for a family dinner or group outing!

The Best Red Robin visit yet! On a Wednesday evening, my party of 4 re-visited this East Bay location.  We all had a mind for it the last few days and we knew it was time.  It was low-key birthday visit, but we knew better than to mention that inside.  From setting foot in the front door to leaving, we had a great service and food experience!  We walked in and were seated immediately.    Our server was cute, smiling, and took care of all our needs.  She got our orders right without hesitation, including one kids customized burger.  The BLTA and the Bleu Ribbon Burger were done to perfection.  Steak fries weren't so hot they caused pain, but still hot.  We had 4 drinks at the table that were refilled right on time every time.  Even paying the check was fast! Best visit ever.
Good burger and fries. This location is a stand out because the staff here is incredibly polite and helpful. They do customer service right.

It's was okay. Took awhile to get our drinks(10mins) but the food was good. Service sucked. The lady was either tired or just biased against 25 yr olds. i dunno they were all Slow and it seemed like all the serving staff  was forcing the "happy" attitudes. there wasn't even napkins or silverware given when we got our food. Just seemed like the manager cared about eating and doing the schedule in the dining area rather than making a coeisive team. red robin in brentwood is turning dumpy.  trashy almost...

The wife and I love Red Robin, I have never had a "bad" experience here, only one time where one of the servers was non-existent, we got water, then the food came from someone else, and the check showed up from her, we saw her twice, at the order and at the check, no refills. Other than that, we really enjoy coming here...

Food is good, had their clucks and shrimp. Have to get used to not getting as many fries but that's only because the fries is unlimited. It can get crowded during the weekend nights too. So go to the bar if you can to eat without having to wait to be seated at the table. Nice that there are other restuarant options in that area. Service was ok.

I'm giving 1 star, only because the system won't let me give a "0"  star.  We normally like eating at Red Robin, Our onion rings are always superb. Last night, 5/23/13 was no different. It went downhill from there.  The Manager told us they didn't have any clean plates; they were being washed. So he gave us some napkins to put our food on. ....And we still stayed there to eat. Our burgers and "Clucks and fries" came, but the french fries had never been cooked - they were refrigerator cold. This was promptly sent back. When our order finally came - still not correct mind you; One of the hamburgers was rare, when it had been ordered as well-done.  ....Now to the Clucks and fries. The Clucks (Chicken strips) were raw. Imagine receiving 4 pieces of raw chicken as your meal.  ...Never again.

I'd formed my opinion of this place before I'd stepped inside the double doors. Corporate burger joint, bottomless fries (yeah, I can imagine what THAT'LL do to my bottom), cheese, mayo, & globs of fat aplenty.  I knew right away that this place couldn't possibly be any good for me! That being said, I ended up there with a group of friends today & had a really nice time.  I was impressed that the menu with the nutritional facts is sitting right on the table when you walk in.   I ended up ordering the Jamaican jerk grilled chicken sandwich (which weighs in around 700 cals, 11grams of fat).  This is one of the more calorie-conservative menu choices, and was very tasty. I enjoyed the pineapple slices and Tender, juicy chicken.  I even had enough self-control to stop after the first round of steak fries! Good food, great company, and wonderful service...it may not have been my choice of places to go, but I'm sure fate will bring me back to Red Robin again soon, and I won't be mad!

What can I say about Red Robin that you don't already know. They do good hamburgers and it beats the regular drive thru burger option. I have always received good service at this location and its the one place I can come with my family and everyone can find something they like on the menu.

We used to frequent their restaurant in Redding and loved the place, unfortunately this one is not as good.    Very loud, the service is haphazard and the wait for food nearly took an hour.   Our server was more interested in texting and couldn't get our order right even though it was not difficult.    The worst part was our food was barely lukewarm when it finally got to our table and when we wanted to speak to the manager, none could be found.   Very disappointing compared to one at Sun Valley or the one we frequented in Redding.
Just love this place. Great staff. Fresh tasty burgers that defy most chain store food. I likely  ALOT!

This Red Robin is crazy busy on the weekends. A friend called for seating for a group so that a precise time everyone could sit together. RR had it neatly set up and reserved. Great. The downside is that the host/seater was rude to several members of the party who arrived a bit before the majority of the group. Her point was that the whole group had to be there to be sat. No problem if you are taking up regular space while people are waiting but in this case the Set up reserved table was sitting empty and the people in our party had arrived taking up lobby space. Why not filter where they need to go so as to ease up the lobby? Win-win. I guess not sadly.  Next we start to order but our server doesn't want to do separate checks saying that it will be trouble for us with the kitchen. Unfortunately, we must as in a group of 30 plus, some only have credit cards and we didn't want the server to have to figure individual items out later. We should have listened if we could have because the server was right. The food came out at different times so people eating together didn't get their food at even near he same time.  The second mini group to order was the last to be served. Waiting made loads of other food cold. Apparently one side of the kitchen can get food out fast, the other not so much and since there were tickets from our party in both kitchens, disaster.  They should look into why that is? The burgers here are divine and the fries are good when served hot. The beer is cold, the water flows and the new specialty beverages are delish. Sports are on the tvs and the atmosphere is like a loud backyard party.  The server was courteous and refilled the drinks, refilled  fries, etc in a timely way. The food was fresh and enjoyable. A couple stars off for the host rudeness and kitchen inconsistency but overall I would eat here again.

Came here before heading out to watch a movie at RAVE theaters.  Sat at the bar, ordered a glass of blue moon and a burger with a stack of onion rings.  Typical restaurant chain setting, Bartender was nice, food came out fast and tasty.  Unless i was just that hungry.  JK.  That was actually my first experience eating at a RED ROBIN.. YUMMM.  I def go back.

Wow. That's all I can say. So when I approach a new restaurant, I do the "deduction" way of rating. The restaurant starts with 5 stars and they get deducted when something wasn't enjoyable throughout the visit. As you can tell, not a good night for Red Robin. Minus 1 star for being abnormally noisy. The restaurant is set up in an open seating, no dividers between people for privacy. Therefore, the ambient noise gets louder and louder until your head hurts! Like literally. I went home with a headache the noise was so bad. Minus 1 star for inattentive waiters. When you dine, you wish to have a waiter who would provide you with everything before you realize something's missing and ask for it. Wow. Everything I needed my family and I had to ask for. From napkins, to utensils, to drink refills...all the way down to the check. Granted, it was a busy night. But still. I've been to many restaurants on a busy night and everything was spot on. Tonight, I felt like I WAS FORGOTTEN.  Minus 1 star for this one particular incident. There's this one waiter dude who was gargantuan.  Big, huge, tall dude with glasses. He was trying to haul butt through the tables for some reason, RAN INTO MY DAD'S CHAIR HARD ENOUGH TO BUMP ME. AND HE DIDN'T EVEN SAY SORRY OR EXCUSE ME! My goodness, I was definitely taken aback by the complete ignorance and rudeness. The remaining stars left were for the fast seating (about 20 minutes during a busy Saturday evening) and the onion rings (super crispy and good). Other than that, I was greatly let down. Granted, this is a brand new location. I just might give them a try later down the road when they have some time to get their act together.

It's like Chili's on meth. My twins and I walked in immediately got caught up in the excitement - this place was packed and the staff was hustling! We waited about five minutes and were led to a table in the back - winding and squeezing our way through the masses of people and tables. There was immediately a mix up regarding drinks that our waitress tried to say was my error and I very clearly repeated word for word how the exchange went - she finally replied "oh, that's right" and corrected my drink order and canceled the request for a manager to come over and red tag it.  WTF? Another guy came around and provided tables with complimentary baskets of steak fries - that was cool. We ordered our burgers, my kids had cheeseburgers I had the chicken on foccacia with pesto - yum.   I can appreciate our waitress when I asked her how the chicken sandwich is and she spun around to show me the embroidered word "honesty" on her sleeve - apparently, its one of RR's core values so when our waitress replied "i don't like it" , I knew I had to order it! Our food was very good - big fresh warm portions all served with a smile - for the most part.   During opening week they were donating .50 cents to Childrens Hospital for every burger ordered - I thought that was cool and that is why I added the fourth star. Like most chain restaurants their drinks aren't ever much to write home about and that standard applies here too - I hope they add "light pours" to their sleeves. I'd definitely go back but I won't go out of my way to do it.

Pleasantly surprised... but we won't push our luck. I have to admit, one of the reasons we ate here was because were intrigued. Seeing a Red Robin that wasn't protruding out of the side of a mall was a new sight for us, so why not give it a shot? Plus, we figured that it would be as good a place as any. As someone who doesn't frequent this area, I found myself overwhelmed with the simple task of grabbing a bite to eat with my pregnant wife and mom-in-law before we resumed baby shopping. Retail porn - that's the only way I can describe this area. Home Depot on one side, Lowe's on the other. Target here, Wal-Mart just down the street. A little overkill, don't you think? But I digress.... Wait staff - decent. attentive enough. Drinks - foofy iced teas and lemonades abound. good enough. Food - Now maybe we were just hungry, but I have to say that the food was pretty good! Wifey and I had chicken "burgers," and she had a side of garlic fries. Mom-in-law had a burger. No complaints from any of us.  I'm sure that if we chose to visit this location more often, it would become more and more obvious that this is a typical chain restaurant - as most places do. For this visit, at least, solid 3 stars.

Five stars just for the service! Shelby is the best! We came here one night with my wife and daughter. Me and my wife decided that we are going to share what we have but Shelby brought us half of each order (mushroom burger and chicken salad). And she always refilled our preckled lemonade.

IDK lately I've been giving good reviews on dope places so far. 5 stars. I had a really good time here with our family. The service was awesome. They made sure we got our food and got good drinks. The waitresses were very tentative, except for the napkins that we had to wait for a good minute. I had a kick butt "new" burger called burning love haha...yah that was really good with jalopeno in there and some salsa....delicious!

Good God.  Thats all I can say.  The other night my girlfriend and I left from the Rave Theater and wanted to get something sweet that we could share.  She wanted me to drive back into Antioch to go to Chili's.  I suggested that we go to Red Robin as it was just across the lot.  She agreed and off we went.   First off, the place was busy busy busy and loud loud loud.  We were seated right away (right next to the pay station so we are sure to get great service) and started to pour over the menue looking for desert.  Guess what.  DESERT IS NOT LISTED ON THE MENU!!!!!  We were puzzled. The restaurant must have desert.  Its a sit down restaurant for cryin out loud. Our waitress finally noticed us fifteen minutes later and asked us what we wanted.  I asked her about deserts.  She gave us the little booklet that they give you the check in.  Hmm... That strikes me as odd.  We asked for water while we waited.  Another ten or so minutes pass and she finally brings us our water (thank God it was clean water and not dirty tasting tap water).  We order some ice cream cake thing (only one of the three choices for desert).  The desert was ok at best.  Not at all worth the $6.00 it was.  The service after we got noticed was horrid.  When your glass is completly empty (beverage AND ice), it is nice to be noticed for a refill right???  WRONG!!! I HAD TO ASK FOR REFILLS FOR MY GIRLFRIEND AND MYSELF FOR FRIGGEN WATER!!!!!  Out waitress walked past us at least fifteen times over the course of our stay at this God forsaken restaurant and I had to get her friggen attention.   Needless to say, I have had better service at Burger King then this particular Red Robin.  Stay Away.

I am weary of Red Robin's now as I have had some bad experiences. I do have to agree that the open seating enviornment is less than desirable and it feels like a mall food court with waitstaff.  Our waitress was the very opposite of non-attentive. In fact, she must have come ask if we were ready to order 8 times in 15 minutes and I was there with a good friend catching up and it felt like we were being rushed.  The food we had that day was fine, nothing stellar that set the experience apart from anything.

The dining room was so cold people were heading to their cars to get jackets.  We asked 5 times to have them raise the temperature.  Other tables were getting upset as well.  The server kept promising to have the manager fix it, but nothing was done.  We were told that the manager was in the kitchen and couldn't do anything about it.  The only consolation we received was that the unit was recently repaired and people were complaining for days about the room being too warm. (Not my problem)  It was so chilly that our food was cold before we were halfway done eating.  No tip!  We have had very few good experiences here.  We will get burgers at Diggers Diner when we're in Brentwood from now on.
Service great, food usually great, but twice I asked for my burger well done no pink and it was medium rare yuck.

Usually I enjoy Red Robin, this location could do much better. The server was slow as molasses. The chicken wrap was good, but the cupcake frosting was way more sweet than the last time I had it, I had a bite of my husbands cheesecake bites mine was frozen in the middle, ewww. I think I will stick with the Manteca Red Robin.

I've given this place 8 tries (I love their food), but last night will be my last.  The service was great 1 out of the 8 times, but the rest were very slow. Last night: After at least 20 minutes of waiting for our food we ordered. Our waitress tells us that she forgot to send in the food to the kitchen. Then after all that, she goes on a break without telling us and we don't see her for another 15 minutes. Then we asked if we can get boxes for our food, it took another 10 minutes just to get that. I work at a restaurant so I'm generally very patient with the staff, but this was ridiculous since she wasn't that busy. She had enough time to talk to the table next to us for a good 8 minutes (about job employment somewhere else), but can't take 20 seconds to walk and get our boxes after we asked. I felt bad because I only gave $3 dollars for a tip, but we barely saw her the hour+ we were there. I rather wait 10 minutes longer to get into BJ's than go back here.

I love red robin but this one left a real bad taste in my mouth, actually no taste cause the service was so terrible I didn't even get my food.  Waited for 45 minutes and still no food the waiter was absolutely horrible.  Stay far away from this place
My fav is the Chicken ceasar salad wrap. We come he quite often and everytime the food is great and the service is good.

I had just moved into this area so I wanted something that I KNEW would be great so we went to Red Robin. It was a slow night so we were seated right away. Waitress comes up and gets our drink orders. My brother gets a soda, I get water and my boyfriend orders a Guinness. Then asks about the sizes and how much each were. The waitress responds with a roll of the eyes and says. "Ummm like six bucks or something". Sorry?? Is it our fault that you didn't study the menu and prices. I was immediately turned off. She plopped the basket of fried on our table. I am NOT EVEN KIDDING.. we had 5 fries in there. It was stupid. When we got our food it was the same thing, like 5 fries in the basket and I got the California Chicken Burger with bacon and avo. AWFUL. I couldn't taste the avo OR the bacon. I had to open it up to see if it was even in there. They spread a thin layer of guacamole on one side of the bun and put 1 slice of floppy bacon. FLOPPY!! How hard is it to make bacon. I was pissed. Bad service and bad food. Never again Red Robin!!
I really like Red Robin their drinks are great and their burgers are very good.  I would recomend this place.  NEVER and I repeat NEVER go to Johny Carino's  on Lone Tree Way

I have always really liked Red Robin when I have tried it in the past. However, my first experience at this Brentwood location left alot to be desired.  All we wanted was a cup of coffee and a dessert since we just saw a movie. U know, something quick and sweet.  We waited for 1/2 hour to get to our table, and then 1/2 hour to recieve a menu, and then 1/2 hour to receive our lousy dessert.  And I mean lousy dessert.  Not a good experience, and I will not be back.

I'll be the first to admit that most of the times that I go to Red Robin locations I get horrid service, but this time was different. Our server Karla was absolutely wonderful. She repeated our order back to us, saved us money by suggesting things, and made sure we had everything we needed through out the entire meal. My only problem with the place was the table next to us. News flash parents: restaurants are NOT playgrounds. I was pleasantly surprised with the experience and would definitely go back.

I've been here several times with my boyfriend. Burgers are good and prices aren't that bad. We both LOVE the fries. Service has always been slow but ok until a couple of weeks ago. Our waiter was one of the worst.  The place was pretty empty when we were seated. We waited for about 15 minutes for the waiter who showed up looking super grumpy as if we had just ruined his day.  He took our order which was just two burgers, nothing special. Thirty minutes passed and there was no sign of our food or waiter.  I made my way to the rest room and saw him sitting in a booth with other employees laughing away. Was he on break? I don't know but if he was we would've appreciated knowing so we didn't have to sit and wonder what happened.  Our food must have been sitting out for a while because by they time it was served to us, it was barely warm.  Never once did the waiter return to our table to ask if we needed refills or anything else.

Went here for my daughter's 16th birthday and really enjoyed it. Service was very efficient. Our server overheard us talking about our daughter's birthday and made her a little sundae that totally caught us by surprise. When a manager heard it was her 16th, she brought a piece of Mudpie. Food was great, employees were friendly. Will be going again!

The food is ok the service is the worst. We felt ignored and our waitress seem to be the floor manager. High end burger joints should be trying to exceed the customers expectattions. This place just does not care.
Wasn't impressed.  Food was blah, service was blah, enviro blah.  Kind of expensive for what we got.  Won't go back anytime soon.

In general Red Robin has been very good to us. But not the new Brentwood location.  The layout of the restaurant is totally weird. As others have said, there are absolutely no dividers so the volume is very loud. I actually had to lean into my family members and talk loud so they could hear me.  The waiters messed up orders on three occasions:  1.) A drink was brought to us that wasn't ours.  2.) My son's dinner was brought to another table, and according to Red Robin, as soon as it's put down on the wrong table, they can't give it to the right table and has to be recooked. So my son had to wait double the time to get his food.  3.) Entrees were brought to our table that weren't ours.  Because of the second ordeal the kids got free deserts and my son's meal was free.  We spent way more time there than we would have because it took forever for my son to get his meal.  I cut them some slack because they just opened and some of the waiters are probably inexperienced.  As for the food - it was just as I expected. GREAT!

----Amber is the best server here------- Yesterday was the first I ever went to this particular Red Robins and needless to say with all the reviews my hopes weren't too high...but after experiencing my dinner I must not agree with some of the other bad reviews.  1) Right when the boyfriend and I were just walking up the steps someone opened the door for us immediately. chilvary isn't dead :)  2) +1 star. After we walked in we witnessed a pair being walked out the front because well they brought like caged animals in maybe ferrets. And when the manager told them they weren't allowed to bring animals into the building because of health codes...they were actually astonished. And I called those people stupid. 3) -1 star. Before sitting down we had to wait for a server...and here's the reason: We were okay with waiting for servers it was just the fact that there were 3 servers on the counter chatting up about idunno sales at the mall. Very distracting. 4) After being seated our server Amber immediatley asked us if we wanted a drink...(now this is where it starts getting good) Within 2 minutes we were brought our beverages and throughout the whole dinner I never saw the bottom of my glass. Amber consistently switched out my glasses before I even asked infact I never had to ask for a refill and I LOVE THAT! This is how I see it you pay 2.95 for a drink right?! Complete rip off!!! Now when you get service like what Amber did it feels like you got your money's worth :)  5) When our appetizer came out..not even 5 minutes later our entrees came out. Normally I would be a little upset because my food will become jealous of eachother haha no. I just like enough time to savor each meal and when both meals came out Amber quickly noticed and apologized to our table. LOVED IT THE MEAL WAS DELICIOUS AS EXPECTED AND SERVICE AMAZING because of that we tipped Amber 30% of the bill!!
We ALWAYS get great service at the RR, the food is just dandy as well. ALL of their staff appear to truly care about you and your dining experience. Well done to whomever manages this place.
Good food Yumm haha what can you expect its red robin its the same as a kid service,food,expectations. has bottomless fries and bottomless drinks...

Usually Red Robin is always amazing. The food was great as expected. But the service was sub par. The waitress took far to long on our drink and frie refills. It also took her ages to run the bill. Go here If you want a great burger with tastey fries and drinks... Hopefully the service will step it up a notch

I looooove red robin.  But the last 3 times i've been here I've had terrible experiences! Experience #1-Waitress put an accidental 40 minute delay on our food and didn't comp us anything!! What!?? I have a screaming toddler and you can't offer me a free drink or appetizer? Experience #2-I asked for more fries as soon as the waitress brought our food because I know they take forever, she brought them to me 20 minutes later and gave me a dirty look and was rude when I asked for a box! Uh yah, I was done eating! Experience #2- Walked in for lunch with my son and husband and the restaurant wasn't busy at all.  I said I had 3 in my party and she told me it would be a 10 min. wait.  I was already confused at that! As I waited several families walked in and were seated right away.  Huh? My thought is they were trying to put me far away from everyone else because we had a toddler.  Well Red Robin, you have now lost loyal customers.

Went here with my girls when they were home for Thanksgiving from college. Red Robin is just like Chili's. The food was good as expected. The service was Just-OK, the place was very busy. The waitress made sure our drinks were always filled. It also took her a while to take our order. Go here If you want a great burger with tasty fries and drinks.

My Hubby and I love Red Robin, we frequented the one in Newark when we lived in Fremont and now we frequent the one in Pleasanton on our way home from work some nights.  So when we were shopping in Brentwood we happily chose Red Robin for dinner.  Unfortunately the service at this location is not up to par with our regular locations.  We've been to the P-Town location on very busy nights and still had very attentive service, so busy is not an excuse in my book.  First of all Im giving 2 stars because we like the food and our waitress was friendly when we did see her.  However it took awhile for her to come by and take our drink and food orders and when she saw we needed refills she said she would be back in a few with more drinks but a few was generally like 10 minutes.  A different person brought out our food and we asked that person for a couple things of ranch as my Hubby had a salad with no dressing and I wanted some for my fries, but the person never brought our ranch nor told our waitress.  I also remembered I wanted mustard for my veggie burger.  So our food sat in front of us for at least 10 minutes gettin cold before we finally saw our waitress and asked her for ranch and mustard and then it took her 5 min to bring it out.  While we were eating the manager came by with a tray full of baskets of fries.  She shoved one down next to my basket of food and said "fries?" As I looked up at her confused since I hadn't asked for more, I still had half of mine left and was getting full.  I shook my head no still confused and she said "well they are bottomless and maybe your waitress thought you would want them" then she walked off to the next table to offer fries.  I was confused and now had a full basket of fries that would be going to waste crowding our table. So overall we were unimpressed with the service and just left kind of irritated and ready to go home.

The food was cold, the service was very bad. The Server had attitude when I told h my food was cold. I simply asked him to warm it on the microwave. He replayed in a salty attitude it would take another 10-15 minutes. I've had this waiter before, he's in the wrong line of work.

You're probably gonna wonder why four stars when reading this but bear with me and I can explain. Having been to a red Robin in fairfield before and waiting forever for food (We were positively anorexic by the time we ate) I have avoided these places for years. This one is right by the rave theater and although we have passed by before have never stopped. We took a swing and figured why not. The place was half empty and not noisy, they took us to our seats and gave is the menu without problem. The waitress came and took our order without problem, she was fantastic. Problem? She was only covering while JD was on break. Yikes, big let down. They lady would come and refill drinks, ask if you needed anything without having to be waved at or anything. JD? You could send up a signal flare and he still wouldn't see you. He continued to serve other tables and fly about from place to place without so much as looking our way, (I tried tripping him but he skipped over my leg and continued on). Now why the four stars? The food baby all about the food. Now bear in mind this is a buger/fast food joint but the chicken I had was advertised as hot and spicy. OMG! Did they understate that. WOW what a great surprise, normally hot and spicy for a chain means mild and meager. This place should serve a fire extinguisher with this one. I love it. Like I have said before i don't eat food or ambiance so could really care less about that and the service could have been better. The food, youser. Perfect love it. Will be back.

Let me start off by saying, I have never EVER walked out of a restaurant... Until I came here. I have been to this location a total of 3 times.  The first time, it was OK. Now for the grand finale (prepare for a novel). We walk in, and the place is deserted. There are exactly two tables occupied. We're seated by one of the 5 hosts standing at the front counter, after they argued about which would seat us. After we were sat, we waited.. and waited.. and then we waited. I looked at my clock for a reference. We had to be sitting at least ten minutes with people walking by and around us, not saying a word. This always pisses me off. At least say "I'll (or someone) will be right with you."  Anyhow this chick finally comes over after we are there for about 20 minutes, and she really tried to walk away without taking our order. Hubby ordered a beer, the rest of us, simple drinks (there were 4 at our table). After another ten minutes, we still hadn't seen our drinks.  Let me mention here that by this point there were 2 new tables near us occupied and a new table came in much after. Inattentive waitress had taken the other 2 tables orders by this time and had greeted new table. After about 13 minutes I went to the host and asked if she could ask someone about our drinks. I couldn't find anybody and not even the fountain drinks had come. There was no excuse. About 3 minutes later, the manager brings us our drinks and says " the bar was backed up." Really? It's a beer not a specialty mixed drink, not to mention there isn't another person in the darn place drinking. WTE.  Non-caring waitress comes by a few minutes later to tell us they are "traying up" our food. Fine. I'm just a LITTLE irritated by the fact that the table that ordered after us has gotten their drinks, appetizers, AND food.  So after another 15 minutes and seeing not only the other 2 tables get their food, but the LAST table besides us, who came in at least 20 minutes after us, get their food, we were DONE. My blood was boiling. We walked out and nobody even noticed. They probably didn't care anyways.  I cannot stand servers who disappear. Are my drinks taking too long? Say something.. "sorry, It'll be just a moment," would suffice. Food taking too long? LET ME KNOW. I'm not a cold-hearted betch. I know stuff happens. But by you ignoring me, you piss me off, and that 20% tip I start off intending to give, dwindles.  I can swear on anything I will NEVER return to this location.  It's sad because I have fond memories of the Concord location. Love that one.  Brentwood Red Robin, Piss off. You disgust me.  KBye:)

I went to this Red Robin for lunch with my husband today. Burgers are always great. We had the Guacamole bacon burger and the mushroom burger. The issue today was more with service and attitude and the bottomless fries policy.  The idea of having as many fries as you want is a great one at first sight. However, not when the corporate office puts limits on it. When we talked about it with our waiter, it told us that the corporate office puts a limit of 3 oz of fries per serving (we counted about 6 fries). So when you first get your order all you get is about half a dozen fries. Then it takes the waiter forever to bring you more when you ask for more and again you get about 3oz as per the corporate policy, then again if you want 6 more fries you wait even longer. At each round the wait is longer. So I say get rid of this offer which is bogus, bring a nice serving of fries with the original order and be done with it, since Red Robin is being cheap about it. I am going to write the corporate office about this. The waiter tried to be accommodating as much as he could. Not a fun experience. My husband and I decided that when we go back we will immediately ask for our refill when we give the order so we can have at least 12 fries each when we first get our burger. Because by the time we ask for our second basket we will be done with our burger. That's how long it took this time and we don't eat fast.

I have been there twice now within a couple days... others wanted to try it out so I came along for the ride. What are the chances that I would get the same server both times. Once in the evening, the other in the afternoon.    The first time I had Carrie as a server I was a bit surprised that after a five minute wait we were greeted with "are you ready to order?" we weren't, but I think the offer of a beverage would have been nice. I ordered the Baileys shake, my friend ordered another beverage with alcohol. Once again, my friend was sitting facing the kitchen and I think she would have noticed if there was a fire.    Our food finally came out about 1/2 an hour after ordering. My server set my food down in front of me and called me Ms. Picky since I ordered my burger withour onions or pickles. Hmmmmm, never been called that before. By the time I got my food, my drink was empty. I was not offered another drink but given a glass of what tasted like water right out of the tap. Yuck.   I do agree with the review that had the comment about the restaurant being noisy. It was almost deafening when it was time to sing a birthday song.     I was at first amazed that their fries were refillable, until I got my burger.... only a handfull, that would explain it.    I will not go back unless someone I am with wants to go. Not that impressed with the service, food or management.
